children.definition: exposure, of a child, Hdt. 1.116, E. Ion 956; also of the putting out of Ulysses on the shore of Ithaca, Arist. Po. 1460a36.
exhibition, ἀργυρωμάτων D.S. 34/ 5.2.35 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: setting forth, exposition, τῶν ὅρων Arist. APr. 48a25, 49b6.

children.label: b
children.definition: exhibition of a particular instance, ἀποδεῖξαι τῇ ἐκθέσει ib. 28b14; κατὰ τὴν ἔ. ἑκάστου Id. Metaph. 1090a17, cf. 992b10, Epicur. Nat. 15.23, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.7 (pl.).

children.label: III
children.definition: stakes, at play, Alciphr. 3.54.

children.label: IV
children.definition: public notice, ἔ. ποιεῖσθαι SIG 685.37 ( Crete), cf. PHib. 1.29.10 (iii B.C.).

children.label: V
children.definition: prescription, Alex.Trall. 1.11.

children.label: VI
children.definition: setting out of terms in a series, Theol.Ar. 51 (pl.) ; series, Moderat. ap. Stob. 1 Prooem. 9, Nicom. Ar. 1.7.

children.label: b
children.definition: particular enunciation, Procl. in Euc. p.203 F., al.

children.label: VII
children.definition: salient angle, Ph. Bel. 82.3 (pl.) ; projection of bastions, GDI 5597 ( Ephesus).
writing of lyric verses to the left of the previous line, opp. εἴσθεσις (q.v.), Sch. Ar. Ra. 1548, al.

children.label: VIII
children.definition: list, schedule, POxy. 291.3 (i A. D.), etc.

children.label: IX
children.definition: table of musical notes, Aristid.Quint. 1.11.

children.label: X
children.definition: Hsch.
lawless, unlawful, Ph. 2.502, Phint. ap. Stob. 4.23.61, POxy. 129.4 (vi A. D.) ; monstrous, ὄναρ Plu. Caes. 32 ; ὑποθέσεις Phld. Sto. 339.18 ; εὑρήματα Ph. 1.335 ( Sup.).
one must set forth, Str. 17.1.1 ; one must arrange, tabulate, ἐφʼ ἑνὸς στίχου πάντας [ἀριθμούς] Plu. An.procr. 2.1027d, cf. Iamb. in Nic. p.44P.
balcony, Sm. 3 Ki. 6.4.
expository, λόγος ἐ. τινος Aphth. Prog. 8, cf. Theo Prog. 4.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐ. τρόπος, = ἔκθεσις II.b, Alex.Aphr. in APr. 34.7. Adv. -κῶς Simp. in Ph. 948.25.

children.label: III
children.definition: enunciatory, Stoic. 2.62.
sent out of the house, sent away, E. Andr. 70 ; exposed, of a child, Act.Ap. 7.19, Man. 6.52 ; cast away, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: projecting, salient, Sor. 1.68; opp. κρυπτός, Heliod. (?) ap. Orib. 49.4.23.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἔκθετον, τό, = ἐκθέτης, Al. Ez. 42.3.
run out : make a sally, Ar. Lys. 456 ; ἐκ τοῦ τείχους X. HG 3.1.7 ; of javelins, fly out, Plu. Marc. 16 : rush, hurry out, Arist. EN 1149a28.
deification, consecration, OGI 56.53 ( Canopus, iii B.C.), Ph. 2.594, al.
divinizing, Procl. in Prm. p.838S., in Ti. 3.205 D.
suck the breast, LXX Is. 66.11 :— Pass., Hp. Mul. 1.73 ; to be sucked out, Arist. HA 587b27.
becoming soft, relaxation, σαρκῶν Hp. Aph. 5.16, cf. Art. 52 :—also ἐκθήλ-ῡσις Nic. Fr. 135.

soften, weaken, τὸ σκέλος ἐκτεθηλυσμένον γίνεται Hp. Art. 52, cf. 56; make effeminate, στρατιὰν ταῖς ἡδοναῖς Str. 5.4.13 ; τὴν νεότητα ταῖς ἀγωγαῖς D.H. l.c.; ψυχάς Corn. ND 20 :— Pass., ἐκτεθηλυμμένος καὶ τῇ ψυχῇ καὶ τῷ σώματι Plb. 36.15.2, cf. 28.21.3, D.C. 50.27 ; of plants, become enfeebled, Thphr. CP 3.1.3.

data.quote: ἐκτεθηλυμμένος καὶ τῇ ψυχῇ καὶ τῷ σώματι

children.label: II
children.definition: make a feminine of, EM 473.35.
hunt out, catch, X. Cyn. 5.25, Plu. Pomp. 26 ; τῇ ἀκοῇ πότερον.. Max.Tyr. 31.3.
one must hunt out, Plu. Comp.Nic.Crass. 4, Max.Tyr. 34.4.
Hdt. 6.31, Arist. Mir. 832a29, Plu. Crass. 31.
make savage, τινάς Ph. Fr. 98 H. ; ἑαυτόν Longus 1.20:— Pass., become quite wild or savage, Ph. 1.430, Iamb. Protr. 5 ; also, assume animal shape, E. Ba. 1331.
exhaust a treasure, Phalar. Ep. 12 (dub.l.).

definition: ἔκθιβος and ἔκθροιβος· τὸ λῶμα τοῦ χιτῶνος, Hsch. ; cf. ὄχθοιβος.

children.definition: oppression, LXX Mi. 7.2.
squeeze out, Arist. HA 578b4, 626a20, Epicur. Ep. 2p.50U., Nic. Al. 626:— Pass., Arist. HA 522a20 ; to be forced from oneʼs position, Plu. Sull. 19.
Pass., to be crowded, cramped, of troops, X. An. 3.4.19.
squeeze, press, σταφυλήν LXX Ge. 40.11 :— Pass., aor. 2 part. ἐκθλῐβείς Dsc. 1.112.

children.label: b
children.definition: squeeze out, Arist. Mete. 342a9 ( Pass.).
elide a letter at the beginning or end of a word, οὐ γὰρ οἷόν τε εὑρέσθαι τὸ ῡ -όμενον A.D. Conj. 228.17, cf. D.H. Dem. 43.

data.quote: οὐ γὰρ οἷόν τε εὑρέσθαι τὸ ῡ -όμενον

children.definition: pressure, bruise, Hp. ap. Gal. 18(2).510, cf. 12.343.
one must squeeze out, Gp. 18.17.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj. -τέος, α, ον, gloss on ἐκβλιστέος, Hsch.
squeezing out, Hp. Aph. 7.85, Arist. Mete. 342a15, Epicur. Ep. 2p.50U. ; τοῦ λοιποῦ (sc. οὔρου) Gal. UP 5.16.

children.label: II
children.definition: affliction, distress, LXX Ez. 12.18.

children.label: III
children.definition: ecthlipsis, ejection of a letter, as σκῆπτρον, σκᾶπτον, A.D. Conj. 230.10, etc.; also, elision, Eust. 984.15 (pl.).

die away, to be like to die, γέλῳ (for γέλωτι) ἔκθανον were like to die with laughing, Od. 18.100 ; ὁρῶντες ἐξέθνῃσκον ἐπὶ τῷ πράγματι Antiph. 190.7 ; ὑπὸ γέλωτος ἐ. Plu. Adul. 2.54c ; ὑπὸ τοῦ δέους Luc. Icar. 23, etc.

to be in a death-like swoon, ἐξέθανε πεντάκις ὥστε τεθνάναι δοκέειν, Hp. Epid. 5.42, cf. Philem. 1.6 D.; ὁ ἐκτεθνεώς, opp. ὁ ὄντως τεθνηκώς, Pl. Lg. 959a ; opp. ἀποθνῄσκειν, Arist. HA 521a11, cf. Pr. 962b4:—so in S. Tr. 568 (though Nessus was really dying) ἐκθνῄσκων may retain its usual sense, fainting away, at the point of death.
become mortified, τὸ φλεγμαῖνον ἐκτέθνηκεν Hp. VC 19.
to be terrified of, τὰς νόσους ἐκτεθνήκασι Phld. Herc. 1251.18.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀποθνῄσκω, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 27, Aret. SD 2.13, D.C. 48.37.
feast on, c. acc., A. Pr. 1025.
make turbid, Procl. Par.Ptol. 183.

definition: ἐκθόοντας ἐξερχομένους, Hsch. (leg. -θέοντας). ἐκθοράξει· ἐκδιώξει, Id. (fort. ἐκθράξει,

children.definition: aor. -εθόρησα, Plu. Nob. 19.
ἐξέσσυται Democr. 32 ap. Gal. 17 (2).28) collat. form for ἐκθρῴσκω, τῇ ψυχῇ M.Ant. 8.51; start up from sleep, Aret. SA 2.9.
disturb, disquiet, Poll. 1.117:— Pass., ἐκ τῶν ῠπνων ἐκθορυβούμενοι Aret. SD 1.5.
bringing up, rearing, Ael. NA 3.8, Porph. ap. Eus. PE 3.11.
lament aloud for, Luc. Ocyp. 113.
make public, noise abroad, BGU 1061.19 ( Pass., iB.C.).
speak out loud, Poll. 6.207.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be startled out of, τῶν ὕπνων Gal. 16.221. ἔκθροιβος, v. ἔκθιβος.
clear from clots, σώματα Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.2.10; ἕλκος Paul.Aeg. 6.60.
coagulation, αἵματος Dsc. 1.128.7 ; curdling of milk, Gal. 14.142.
chatter out, Poll. 6.207 :— Pass., ἐκτεθρυλημένος ib. 206.

leap out of, c. gen., ἔκθορε δίφρου Il. 16.427 ; ἐκ δʼ ἔθορε κλῆρος κυνέης 7.182, cf. 23.353; ἐ.ναῶν A. Pers. 457; κραδίη δέ μοι ἔξω στηθέων ἐκθρῴσκει, of the violent beating of the heart, Il. 10.95 : abs., leap forth, Ἀπόλλων ἀντίος ἐξέθορε 21.539, cf. Corn. ND 19 : rarely c.acc., δίκτυον ἐ. AP 9.371 ; start up, ἀπὸ τοῦ ὕπνου Luc. DMar. 2.3; come from the womb, to be born, h.Ap. 119.
carry away as by a storm, Moschio Hyp. 1.
pustule, Hp. Epid. 3.7 (pl.), al.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐκθύω I) expiatory sacrifice, Arist. Ath. 54.6 (pl.).
θυμαίνω, aor. ἐξεθύμηνα ( -θύμησαν codd.) Ant.Lib. 7.4 : fut. ἐκθυμᾰνῶ Phld. Ir. p.16W.
ardour, eagerness, Plb. 3.115.6.
burn as incense, E. Ion 1174.
turn into vapour, Str. 15.1.22, Heraclit. Ep. 6.4 :— Pass., to pass off in fumes, Arist. Mete. 388a8, v.l. in Dsc. 1.98, Ph. 1.500, M.Ant. 6.4.
evaporation, expansion, θερμοῦ Marcellin. Puls. 59.

spirited, ardent, φίλων ὑπηρεσίαι Plu. Aem. 12, cf. App. BC 5.38 ( Sup.). Adv. -μως ardently, Diog.Oen. 15; ἐρίζειν Luc. JTr. 16; vehemently, bravely, ὥρμησε Plb. 2.67.7, cf. 1.17.9 ( Comp.); ἀγωνίζεσθαι D.H. 2.54, etc.
stray, play truant, Eust. 1020.13.
Vett.Val. 183.26 (pl.), Zos. 2.1.2 (pl.) :— written ἐχθυσία, IG ΙΙ(2).142.59 ( Delos, iv B.C.).
needing atonement, Plu. Curios. 2.518b.
atonement, expiatory rites, Plu. Marc. 28.
averting by sacrifices, τῶν εἱμαρμένων Iamb. Myst. 9.3, cf. 1.13 (pl.)(leg. ἐκλ-).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐκθύω II) breaking out, eruption, Hp. Coac. 168.
one must eradicate, φιλαυτίαν τῆς διανοίας Ph. Fr. 100H.
sacrifice, S. El. 572, E. Cyc. 371 (lyr.); destroy utterly, Id. Or. 191 (lyr.):— Med., ἐχθυσεῦνται ( Dor. fut.) τὰ ἱερά SIG 1106.65 ( Cos).

Med., atone for, expiate by offerings, c.acc. rei, ἄγος Hdt. 6.91; τὰ ἀναγκαῖα Iamb. Myst. 9.3 (leg. ἐκλ-) : c. acc. pers., propitiate, appease, τινὰ μακάρων E. Fr. 912.12 (anap.) : abs., make atonement, ὑπέρ τινος (thing or person) Thphr. HP 5.9.8, Plu. Alex. 50, D.C. 41.14; τοῖς θεοῖς Str. 6.2.11.
Med., avert by sacrifices, τὰ εἱμαρμένα Iamb. Myst. 9.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: break out as heat or humours, Hp. Liqu. 6.
gain by flattery, wheedle over, S. Fr. 857.
burst out into loud laughter, X. Smp. 1.16 ; ἀθρόον ἐ. Arist. EN 1150b11:—spelt ἐκκακχάζω, Phld. Ir. p.49 W.: ἐκκαχάζω, v.l. in Sch. Ar. Nu. 1242.

definition: ἐκκαθαίρω, Ion. aor.I- εκάθηρα Hdt. 2.86, Att. -εκάθᾱρα Din. 2.5:—

children.definition: cleanse out:

clear out, οὐρούς τʼ ἐξεκάθαιρον Il. 2.153 ; τὴν κοιλίην Hdt. l.c.; μήτρας, ὀδόντας, Hp. Mul. 1.88, Orib. Syn. 5.25.3; χθόνα ἐκκαθαίρει κνωδάλων he clears this land of monsters, A. Supp. 264; τὸν βίον (i.e.the world) Luc. DDeor. 15[13].1; ἐ.τινά, ὥσπερ ἀνδριάντα, εἰς τὴν κρίσιν clear him of all roughness, polish him up, metaph. from the finishing touches of a sculptor, Pl. R. 361d; ἑαυτὸν ἀπό τινος 2 Ep.Ti. 2.21; ἐ.λογισμόν clear off an account, Plu. Adul. 2.64f :— Pass., to be cleansed, purified, ἐκκεκαθαρμένοι τὰς ψυχάς X. Smp. 1.4, cf. Pl. R. 527d; to be cleared up, explained, Epicur. Ep. 2p.36U.
clear away, Pl. Euthphr. 3a, cf. Arist. HA 625b34 ; τὸ τοιοῦτον ἐ. γένος Diph. 32.17 ; τὴν δωροδοκίαν ἐκ τῆς πόλεως Din. l.c.; κόπρον APl. 16.92.7.
complete cleansing, purification, Muson. Fr. 20p.111H.
sweeping out, Hierocl. in CA 14p.451M.
polishing up, θυρᾶν IG 4.1484.283 (Epid.).
sleep out of oneʼs quarters, X. HG 2.4.24.
sixteen, Hdt. 2.13, etc.
having sixteen angles, Hero *Geep. 164, Simp. in Ph. 55.3.
sixteen fingers long, broad, etc., Ath.Mech. 35.1.
sixteen palms long, 11.4.109.
solid with sixteen surfaces, Ps.- Ptol. Centil. 60.
period of sixteen years, Gem. 8.39.
sixteen years old, Plu. Amat. 2.754e.

children.label: II
children.definition: consisting of sixteen years, χρόνος D.C. 69.8.
sixteen times, Dioph. 2.29.
of sixteen members (sc. περίοδος), Sch. Ar. Pax 382.
consisting of sixteen threads, δίκτυον X. Cyn. 2.5.
of sixteen palms, Poll. 2.157.

definition: ἑκκαιδεκάπηχυς, Dor. ἑκκαιδεκά-πᾱχυς, υ, gen. εος, contr. ους,

children.definition: sixteen cubits long or high, Decr.Byz. ap. D. 18.91, IG ΙΙ(2).161 D 120 ( Delos, iii B.C.), Plb. 5.89.6.
sixteen times as great, Androm. ap. Gal. 13.913.
sixteen feet long, Anon. in Tht. 34.31.
the number sixteen, Dam. Pr. 382.
of sixteen times, χρόνος Aristid.Quint. 1.14.
sixteen stades long, περίβολος Str. 12.4.7.
of sixteen syllables, Σαπφικὸν -ον (sc. -μέτρον) Heph. 10.6, Arg. Theoc. 28.
sixteen days old, [ σελήνη] Sch. Ar. Th. 86.
worth sixteen talents, γύναιον ἑ. with a dowry of sixteen talents, cj. in Men. 402.11.
sixteenth, Hdt. 2.143, etc.
sixteen years old, AP 7.600 ( Jul.).
ship of sixteen banks, Plb. 18.44.6.
period of seventy-six years, Gem. 8.59.
solid with twenty-six surfaces, Papp. in Archim. 2p.536H.
restore, repair, Ostr.Strassb. 736.
figure of fifty-six sides, prob. in Plu. Isid. 2.363a ( ὀκτωκαι-codd.).
out of date, antiquated, AP 11.417 ; unseasonable, POxy. 729.18 (ii A.D.).

definition: ἐκκαίω, Att. ἐκκάω, fut. -καύσω: aor. 1 ἐξέκαυσα Hdt. 4.134, but part. ἐκκέαντες E. Rh. 97:—

children.definition: burn out, τοὺς ὀφθαλμούς τινος Hdt. 7.18; τὸ φῶς Κύκλωπος E. Cyc. 633, cf. 657 (anap.):— Pass., ἐκκάεσθαι τοὺς ὀφθαλμούς to have oneʼs eyes burnt out, Pl. Grg. 473c.

children.label: II
children.definition: light up, kindle, τὰ πυρά Hdt. 4.134, cf. E. Rh. l.c. ; ἐκκέας τῶν ξύλων ἅττʼ ἂν ᾖ δανότατα Ar. Pax 1133 (lyr.): metaph., ἐ. πόλεμον, ἐλπίδα, Plb. 3.3.3, 5.108.5 ; τοὺς θυμούς D.H. 7.35 ; τὴν πρὸς αὐτὸν ὀργήν Plu. Fab. 7 ; provoke to anger, ἔκ με κάεις Herod. 4.49 ; inflame with curiosity, excite, τινά Luc. Alex. 30 ; ἴσῃ φιλοτιμίᾳ πρός τε τὸν δῆμον ἑαυτοὺς καὶ τὸν δῆμον πρὸς ἑαυτοὺς ἐκκαύσαντες Plu. Agis 2 :— Pass., to be kindled, burn up, τὸ πῦρ ἐκκάεται Eup. 340 ; ἐ. τὸ κακόν Pl. R. 556a ; ὀργὴν ἐκκαῆναι LXX 2 Ki. 24.1 ; ὁ δῆμος ἐξεκάετο Plu. TG 13, cf. Luc. Cal. 3, etc.; ἐ. εἰς ἔρωτα Alciphr. 3.67, cf. Charito I.I; ὑπὸ μέθης Parth. 24.2.

data.quote: ἐκκέας τῶν ξύλων ἅττʼ ἂν ᾖ δανότατα
ἴσῃ φιλοτιμίᾳ πρός τε τὸν δῆμον ἑαυτοὺς καὶ τὸν δῆμον πρὸς ἑαυτοὺς ἐκκαύσαντες

children.definition: stimulate, τὴν βλάστησιν Thphr. CP 2.1.3.

children.label: III
children.definition: scorch, ἐκκαίων ὁ ἥλιος Arist. Pr. 867a20 ; of thirst, parch, Luc. Dips. 4.
to be faint-hearted, lose heart, grow weary, v.l. for ἐγκακέω, Ev.Luc. 18.1, 2 Ep.Cor. 4.1, 16, al., cf. Vett.Val. 201.15, Gloss.
pull out with a καλάμη, fish out: hence metaph., wheedle out, Ar. V. 609.

definition: ἐκκαλάξαι κλῖναι τὸ ἱστίον, Hsch. (i.e. ἐκχαλάσαι).

children.definition: call out or forth, summon forth, Il. 24.582, etc.; τινὰ δόμων E. Ba. 170 ; ἔνδοθεν Lys. 3.8 ; crave speech of, τινά S. OT 597 codd.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., call out to oneself, ψυχάς Od. 24.1, cf. Hdt. 8.79, S. Ph. 1264.

call forth, elicit, χαρὰ δάκρυον ἐκκαλουμένη A. Ag. 270 ; ὀργήν Aeschin. 2.3 ; ἴσως ἂν ἐκκαλέσαιθʼ ὑμᾶς D. 4.42, cf. Pl. Euthd. 288d ; λιμὸν ἐ. Antiph. 217.23 ; τοὺς ἱππεῖς entice, provoke to battle, Plb. 1.19.2, cf. Ascl. Tact. 7.1.

inf., call on one to do, S. Tr. 1206 ; ἐ. [ τινὰ] ποτὶ ἔργα Ti.Locr. 104b : plpf. in med. sense, ἐξεκέκλητο πρὸς τὴν πρᾶξίν τινας Plb. 4.57.4 :— Pass., -κληθῆναι πρὸς τὰς ὠφελείας Id. 3.51.11 ; to be provoked, εἴς, ἐπί τι, Phld. Ir. pp. 52,95 W.; ἐς ὀργήν, δάκρυα, Philostr. VS 2.8.4, 2.10.1.
demand, require, ὡς τὰ φαινόμενα-εῖται Epicur. Ep. 2p.36U., cf. 53 U.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., = Lat. evocari, of foreign numina, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.278f.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Med., appeal against, κρίσιν ἐπί τινα ib. Apophth.reg. 178f; refer, προβλήματα ἐπὶ τὴν τῶν ἀλόγων φύσιν ὥσπερ ἀλλοδαπὴν πόλιν ib. Am. prol. 493b.
sweep clean, ἔδαφος πτεροῖς Arr. Peripl.M.Eux. 21, cf. Hsch. s.v. ἐκκοροῦσι :— Pass., EM 322.18.
means of discovery, token, Plu. Cohib. 2.463a (pl.).
suited for discovery, indicative of, c. gen., Stoic. 2.36,72. Adv. -κῶς S.E. P. 2.141.

uncover, τὸ παιδίον Hdt. 1.112; disclose, reveal, ὀργὴ νόον ἐξεκάλυψεν Even. 5 ; πάντʼ ἐκκάλυψον A. Pr. 195, cf. S. Aj. 1003; πάντʼ ἐ. ὁ χρόνος Id. Fr. 918 ; λέγʼ ἐκκαλύψας κρᾶτα E. Supp. 111; ἐ. μυστικοὺς λόγους Phld. Ir. p.46W.: folld. by relat., ἐκκάλυπτε..ἡμῖν οὕστινας λέγεις λόγους E. IA 872 :— Med., uncover oneʼs head, unveil oneself, Od. 10.179 (tm.): pf. fut. ἐκκεκαλύψομαι Ar. Av. 1503 ; opp. ἐγκαλύπτομαι, Pl. Phd. 118a.
unmask, τινά Aeschin. 3.55.

grow quite weary of a thing, τὰς ὀλοφύρσεις Th. 2.51: c. part., πολεμοῦντες ἐξέκαμον Plu. Sol. 8, cf. Pomp. 32, D.C. 40.24; ἐξέκαμεν ὑπὸ γήρως πρὸς τὰ δημόσια he became unfit through age for.., Plu. Cat.Ma. 24; σίδηρος ἐξέκαμε πληγαῖς it is worn out (gnomic) with blows, Id. Caes. 37 ; ἐ. ἡ ἀρετή τισι Max.Tyr. 29.2 [23.2.g].
drink off, τήνδʼ..ἐκκανάξει (sc. κύλικα) Eup. 272, cf. Ael. Ep. 4.
sell off:— Pass., ἐκκαπηλεύεσθαι τῆς χώρας Philostr. VA 1.15.

children.label: II
children.definition: adulterate, Hsch.
evaporate in smoke, Olymp.Alch. p. 73 B.
cut out the heart, Alex.Trall. 1.15.
PPetr. 2p.143 (iii B.C.).
grow to seed, Hp. Art. 8, Gal. 6.537.
growing to seed, Gal. 6.665.
yield as produce, A. Th. 601.

children.label: II
children.definition: reap, enjoy, τὰ ἐκ τῆς γῆς γενήματα PTeb. 105.30 (ii B.C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: exhaust, Thphr. CP 4.8.3.
gather or enjoy the fruit of, ἄλλης γυναικὸς παῖδας ἐ. to have children by another wife, E. Ion 815; ἐ. φιλίαν D.C. 37.56.

children.label: II
children.definition: enjoy the fruit of a thing, c. part., ἀμφοτέροις ἔνσπονδοι ὄντες ἐκκαρπώσασθαι Th. 5.28; ἐ. τινάς exhaust them, drain them dry, D. 24.2.
make into καρύκη (q.v.), in Pass., Hsch., Suid.
damage completely, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.96 ( Pass.).

definition: ἐκκατεῖδον, aor. with no pres. ἐκκαθοράω in use,

children.definition: look down from, Περγάμου ἐκκατιδών Il. 4.508, cf. Q.S. 8.430.
run to stalk, Arist. Pr. 924b27, Dsc. 2.136, cf. ἐκκαυλῆσαι· ἐπιδοῦναι, Hsch.; develop a stem, Thphr. HP 1.2.2, CP 4.3.5.
stalk put forth, Gal. 19.153 (s.v. φύσιγγα).
shooting into a stalk, Thphr. CP 4.3.5.
pull out the stalk: metaph., καυλοὺς τῶν εὐθυνῶν ἐ. pull off the sprouts, i.e. the profits, Ar. Eq. 825.
wood for lighting fires, in pl., S. Fr. 225, D.S. 2.49 : sg., Thphr. Ign. 73 : metaph., ἔ. τόλμης E. Fr. 1031; source of heat, Aret. CA 2.11.
kindling, burning, Arist. Mete. 342a2, Anthem. p.154W.
heating of the body, Aret. SA 1.7 (pl.); of baths, PFlor. 385.88 (v A.D.), Cod.Just. 1.4.26 Intr. (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: sunstroke, Gal. 2.884 ; ἡλίου Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.88.
inflammatory, Ael. VH 11.12.

definition: ἐκκαυχάομαι, strengthd. for καυχάομαι, E. Ba. 31.

children.definition: break, plash, of waves, Apollon. Lex. s.v. κωφόν.
‘pearl’ barley, Hsch.
scatter, ἦτορ ἀπὸ μελέων Q.S. 10.124 (tm.).

definition: ἔκκειμαι, serving as Pass. of ἐκτίθημι,

children.definition: to be cast out or exposed, ἐπορᾶν ἐκκείμενον (sc. τὸν παῖδα) Hdt. 1.110, cf. 122, Longus 1.3; ἁπλοῦν τὸ ἦθος καὶ παντὶ ἰδεῖν ἐκκείμενον D.H. Rh. 10.1.

data.quote: ἁπλοῦν τὸ ἦθος καὶ παντὶ ἰδεῖν ἐκκείμενον

children.definition: to be set up in public, posted up, ἵνʼ ἐκκέοιτο πρὸ τῶν ἐπωνύμων D. 21.103, cf. 58.9; to be set forth, ἡ ἐμὴ προθυμία ἐκκείσθω POxy. 220 vi5; ἐκκειμένων οὖν τῶν βίων Plu. Comp.Ages.Pomp. 1.
to be proposed, ὁ σκοπὸς ἐ. καλῶς Arist. Pol. 1331b31; μισθοὶ παρὰ βασιλέως ἔκκεινται Str. 15.1.46; ἔλασσον τοῦ ἐκκειμένου SIG 577.66 ( Milet., iii/ii B.C.).
to be exposed to, be at the mercy of, Str. 5.2.6, Alciphr. 3.29; τύχαις Plot. 6.8.15; τῷ μέλλοντι Id. 3.6.18 ; also πρὸς τὸ πάσχειν Procl. Inst. 80.
to be set forth, expounded, Arist. Rh. 1419b23; in logical sense, Id. Top. 103b29, cf. APr. 48a8, Epicur. Nat. 28.1, Phld. Sign. 19, etc.
to be set out, ‘taken’, ἐκκείσθω κύκλος, ὁ ἐκκείμενος κῶνος, Archim. Sph.Cyl. 1.5, 28.

children.label: II
children.definition: fall from out, be left bare of, μηροὶ..ἐξέκειντο πιμελῆς S. Ant. 1011.

project, ἐκκειμένη εἰς θάλατταν ἄκρα Str. 5.4.8 ; πύργοι ἔξω ἐκκείμενοι D.C. 74.10; στέρνα προέχοντα καὶ ἐκκείμενα Philostr. Gym. 35 ; φλέβες ἐκκ. Gal. 17(2).97 ; in painting, stand out, Philostr. Im. 2.1.
openly, ἐ. τοῦ ἤθους ἔχειν to be open, frank, Philostr. VS 2.17.
shear completely, Σκυθιστὶ ἐκκεκαρμένος shorn in Scythian fashion, S. Fr. 473.

children.label: II
children.definition: cut off, ἐκ θέρος ἀνδρῶν κείρατε A.R. 4.1033.
out of the road, λαθραῖα κἀκκέλευθα Lyc. 1162 (but Dind. κὰκ κέλευθα, i. e. κατὰ κέλευθα).

empty out, leave desolate, ἄστυ Σούσων ἐξεκείνωσεν A. Pers. 761, cf. LXX Ps. 136(137).7 ; clear out, οἴκημα Pl. Prt. 315d ; στωμυλίαν ἢ ʼξεκένωσε τὰς παλαίστρας Ar. Ra. 1070 ; ἐ. θυμὸν ἐς σχεδίαν γέροντος pour out oneʼs spirit into Charon’s boat, i.e. give up the ghost, Theoc. 16.40 ; χολῆς περισσὸν..ἐ. τῶν ἐγκάτων App.Anth. 3.158 ; ἐ. ἰούς to shoot all oneʼs arrows, AP 6.326 ( Leon.):— Pass., to be left desolate, στένει γαῖʼ Ἀσὶς ἐκκενουμένα A. Pers. 549 (lyr.), cf. Th. 330 (lyr.); Ἀττικὴ τῆς τῶν ἀνθρώπων ἀγέλης ἐκκενωθεῖσα Philostr. VS 1.16.1 ; Μοιράων..μίτος ἐξεκενώθη was exhausted, spun out, IG 14.2002.

data.quote: Ἀττικὴ τῆς τῶν ἀνθρώπων ἀγέλης ἐκκενωθεῖσα

children.definition: unsheath, μάχαιραν LXX Ez. 5.2.
clear away, πέτρας Sammelb. 4368.
prick out, put out, ὄμματα Arist. HA 508b6.

children.label: II
children.definition: pierce, stab, Plb. 5.56.12, LXX Nu. 22.29, Polyaen. 5.3.8.
massacre, LXX Jo. 16.10.

children.label: III
children.definition: stand out, project, Luc. Sat. 24.
requiring both eccentric and epicycle, ὑπόθεσις Procl. Hyp. 2.3.

definition: ἐκκεντρίζω, prob. written for ἐγκ-, Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.185 ; f.l. for ἐκκεντέω, Alex.Trall. 5.6.

children.definition: κύκλος not having the earth as centre, eccentric, Cleom. 1.6, Gem. 1.34, Ptol. Alm. 3.3, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: not occupying a cardinal point, opp. ἔγκ., Vett.Val. 97.11.
eccentricity, Eudem. ap. Theo Sm. p.201 H., Gem. 1.39, Ptol. Alm. 3.3, Iamb. VP 6.31 (pl.), etc.
one must empty, of venesection, Gal. 10.313.
plunder, pillage, sack, Call. Cer. 50 ; cut down, πίτυν AP 9.312 ( Zon.).
pour out and mix, Ath. 2.38a codd. ( εἰς- Kaibel).
make a profit, Just. Nov. 102 Pr.

definition: ἐκκεχυμένως, Adv. pf. part. Pass. of ἐκχέω,

children.definition: profusely, extravagantly, ἐ. ζῆν Isoc. 15.207 ; ἐ. λέγειν without reserve, Pl. Euthphr. 3d ; ἀγαπᾶν Aristaenet. 2.16 ; πράττειν τι Just. Nov. 74.4.
cast a spell upon, in aor. ἐξεκήλησεν, Hsch.
enfeeble, exhaust, A. Eu. 128.
amaze, confound, Hsch., in pf. Pass.; cf. ἐξεκηρίωσας· ἐξέστησας, Id.
banishment by proclamation, Sch.BT Il. 21.575.
banished, cast away, LXX Je. 22.30, Hsch.
proclaim by voice of herald:— Pass., νέκυν ἀστοῖσί φασιν ἐκκεκηρῦχθαι τὸ μὴ τάφῳ καλύψαι S. Ant. 27, cf. 203.

data.quote: νέκυν ἀστοῖσί φασιν ἐκκεκηρῦχθαι τὸ μὴ τάφῳ καλύψαι

children.label: II
children.definition: banish by proclamation, Hdt. 3.148, Plb. 4.21.8, D.S. 14.97 ; τῆς πόλεως, ἐκ τῆς πόλεως, Aeschin. 3.258, Lys. 12.3 :— Pass., ἐκ τοῦ γένους ἐκκεκηρῦχθχι Pl. Lg. 929b ; ἐξεκηρύχθην φυγάς S. OC 430.
cashier, ‘drum out’ of the army, prob. in Arist. Ath. 61.2.

move out of [his lair], put up, ἔλαφον S. El. 567 : metaph., ἐ. τὴν νόσον Id. Tr. 979 (anap.) ; τόδε τὸ ῥῆμα Id. OT 354 ; so σὺ γάρ μʼ ἀπʼ εὐνασθέντος ἐ. κακοῦ Id. Tr. 1242 :— Pass., σκώμμασι μᾶλλον ἢ λοιδορίαις ἐκκινούμεθα Plu. QConv. 2.631c.

data.quote: σὺ γάρ μʼ ἀπʼ εὐνασθέντος ἐ. κακοῦ

children.definition: become hardened, Hippiatr. 104.
cry aloud, ἐκ δʼ ἔκλαγξʼ ὄπα E. Ion 1204.
a womanʼs ornament, IG 11(2).219 B 23 ( Delos, iii B.C.), etc.
break off, Pl. R. 611d ( Pass.), Alciphr. 2.4 ( Pass.) ; δάκτυλον Paus. 8.40.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., grow weak, to be enfeebled, Plu. QConv. 2.671a (s.v.l.) ; τὸ θράσος ἐκκέκλασται ib. Amat. 762f, cf. (Max.Tyr. 35.3.

definition: ἐκκλείω, Ion. ἐκκληΐω or ἐκκλήω, old Att. ἐκκλήω : Att. fut. -κλῄσω E. Or. 1127 : Dor. aor. 1 -κλᾳξα Com.Adesp. 1203.7 (dub.) : pf. ἐκκέκλεικα Men. Sam. 201 :—

children.definition: shut out from, c.gen., ἐ. ἄλλον ἄλλοσε στέγης E. l.c. :— Pass., to be shut out, Id. HF 330.
shut out, exclude from, πόλιν τῆς μετοχῆς Hdt. 1.144 ; τῆς συμμαχίας, τῶν ὅρκων, Aeschin. 2.85, 3.74 : c. acc. et inf., ἐξέκλειον λόγου τυγχάνειν τοὺς ἄλλους D. 19.26.

hinder, prevent, τῷ καιρῷ τὴν κατηγορίαν Plb. 18.8.2 ; τὴν θήραν D.S. 3.16 :— Pass., ἐκκληϊόμενοι τῇ ὥρῃ being prevented by [want of] time, Hdt. 1.31 ; ἐκκλεισθεὶς ὑπὸ τῶν καιρῶν D.S. 18.3 : c. inf., ἐ. ποιεῖν τι Id. 4.32, cf. Arist. MM 1198b16.
shut off, cut off, ζωῆς ὁδούς Opp. C. 2.342.

definition: ἐκκλέπτω, aor. 2 Pass. - εκλάπην X. HG 5.4.12 :—

children.definition: steal and carry off, of persons, [ Ἑρμῆς] ἐξέκλεψεν Ἄρηα he stole away Ares from his chains, Il. 5.390, cf. Hdt. 2.115 (s.v.l.), A. Ag. 662, Eu. 153, X. Ap. 23, Plu. Pyrrh. 2 ; τοὺς ὁμήρους ἐ. ἐκ Λήμνου Th. 1.115, cf. D.S. 12.27 ; τοὺς ἀδικοῦντας οἱ κατήγοροι ἐκκλέπτουσιν Lys. 20.7 ; ἐκ δόμων πόδα E. Or. 1499 : c. gen., τήνδε..ἐκκλέψαι χθονός Id. Hel. 741 ; ἐ. φόνου Id. El. 286 ; ἐ. μὴ θανεῖν ib. 540 ; ἐ. τι τοῦ λόγου to steal it from the story, Pl. R. 449c :— Pass., ὑπὸ τῆς ἀμήτορος παρθένου ἐκκλαπεῖσα Jul. Mis. 352b.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐ. τινὰ λόγοις to deceive him, S. Ph. 55, cf. 968 ; μὴ.. ἐκκλέψῃς λόγον disguise not the matter, speak not falsely, Id. Tr. 437.
subject of appeal, Jahresh. 14.168 ( Tolophon, iii B.C.), Foed.Delph.Pell. 2 B 20 (pl., iii B.C.).
put forth κλήματα, run to wood, Thphr. CP 3.15.4, Gp. 5.40.1.
without share or lot, Gloss.

assembly duly summoned, less general than σύλλογος, Th. 2.22, Pl. Grg. 456b, etc. ; applied to the Homeric Assemblies, Arist. Pol. 1285a11 ; to the Samian Assembly, Hdt. 3.142 ; to the Spartan, Th. 1.87 ; to the meeting of the Amphictyons at Delphi, Aeschin. 3.124 ; at Athens, ἐ. κύριαι, opp. σύγκλητοι, Arist. Ath. 43.4 ; κυρία ἐ., at Amorgos, IG 12(7).237.46 ; ἐ. συναγείρειν, συνάγειν, συλλέγειν, ἀθροίζειν, call an assembly, Hdt. 3.142, Th. 2.60, 8.97, X. HG 1.6.8 ; ἐ. ποιεῖν Ar. Eq. 746, Th. 1.139, al. ; ἐ. ποιεῖν τινί Ar. Ach. 169 ; διδόναι τινί Plb. 4.34.6 ; ἐ. γίγνεται an assembly is held, Th. 6.8 ; καταστάσης ἐ. Id. 1.31 ; ἦν ἐ. τοῖς στρατηγοῖς And. 1.2 ; ἐ. διαλύειν, ἀναστῆσαι, dissolve it, Th. 8.69 ( Pass.), X. HG 2.4.42 ; ἀφιέναι Plu. TG 16 ; ἐ. ἀνεβλήθη was adjourned, Th. 5.45 ; ἐ. περί τινος Ar. Av. 1030, etc.
Comitia, ἐ. λοχῖτις, φρατρική, = Comitia Centuriata, Curiata, D.H. 4.20.
Philostr. VS 2.1.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: LXX, the Jewish congregation, De. 31.30, al.
NT, the Church, as a body of Christians, Ev.Matt. 16.18, 1 Ep.Cor. 11.22 ; ἡ κατʼ οἶκόν τινος ἐ. Ep.Rom. 16.5 ; as a building, Cod.Just. 1.1.5 Intr., etc.

definition: ἐκκλησιάζω, fut. - άσω Ar. Ec. 161, Isoc. 8.2 : impf. ἠκκλησίαζον D. 18.265, 19.60; also ἐκκλησίαζον Lys. 12.73 codd., but usu. with irreg. augm., as if the Verb were a compd. of ἐκ and *κλησιάζω, impf. ἐξεκλησίαζον Lys. 13.73,76 : aor. ἐξεκλησίασα Th. 8.93, D. 21.193 (freq. with vv.ll. ἐξεκκλησίαζον, ἐξεκκλησίασα) :— Med., ἐξεκκλησιάσατο, = ἀγορήσατο, Hsch.s.h.v.:—

children.definition: hold an assembly, debate therein, X. Ath. 1.9, Ar. Av. 1027, X. An. 5.6.37 ; περί τινος Th. 7.2, Isoc. 8.2 ; περί μου ἐπʼ ὀλέθρῳ Ar. Th. 84 ; ὑπὲρ τῆς πόλεως Isoc. 8.13 ; τοιαῦτα ἐκκλησιάσαντες having thus deliberated, Th. 8.77; ἐ. τὰς ἀναγκαίας ἐκκλησίας Arist. Pol. 1292b28.
to be a member of the Assembly, ἐ. ἀπὸ τιμήματος οὐδενός ib. 1294b3.

children.label: II
children.definition: summon to an assembly, convene, τοὺς αὑτοῦ στρατιώτας Aen.Tact. 9.1 ; λαόν D.S. 21.16 ; συναγωγήν LXX Le. 8.3, al. :— Pass., to be called together, ib. Je. 33(26).9, al.
τινὰ πρὸς ἑαυτὸν ἐ. summon considerations before oneʼs mind, Eun. Hist. p.210D.
the holding an ἐκκλησία, Plb. 15.26.9.
the hall of the ἐκκλησία, IPE 12.24.9 ( Olbia, iv B.C.), BCH 35.76 ( Delos), CIG 2270.4 ( Delos) ; = Lat. Comitium, D.H. 4.38.
member of the ἐκκλησία, Pl. Grg. 452e, Ap. 25a, Arist. Pol. 1275a26, Rh. 1354b7.

of or for the ἐκκλησία, ἐ. πίναξ register of voters, D. 44.35 ; αἱ ἐ. ψῆφοι Plu. Cor. 14 ; τὸ ἐ. [ ἀργύριον] pay received for sitting in the ἐκκλησία at Athens and elsewhere, Sch. Ar. Eq. 51 (also μισθὸς ἐκκλησιαστικός Luc. Dem.Enc. 25, etc.), cf. Michel 466 ( Iasos, iii B.C.) ; τὰ ἐ. IG 2(2).1272.

children.label: II
children.definition: clerical, Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.216, Cod.Just. 1.2.17.4. Adv. -κῶς Just. Nov. 83.1.
defensor ecclesiae, Cod. Just. 1.3.41.20, al.
appeal, IGRom. 4.1044 ( Cos), Hsch. s.v. ἔφεσις.
challenging, Plb. Fr. 131 (pl.).
evocatio numinum, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.278f (pl.).

definition: ἐκκλητεύσιμος, ον, gloss on ἐφέσι<μ>ον, Hsch. ( ἐγκλ-cod.).

children.definition: summon a witness under subpoena, Aeschin. 2.68 :— Pass., Id. 1.46, cf. Harp. s.v. κλητῆρες.
appellant, Gloss.
provocative, stimulative, ὀρέξεως Dsc. 2.151. Adv. -κῶς Suid.

selected to judge or arbitrate on a point, ἐ. πόλις an umpire city, Aeschin. 1.89, IG 2(2).111.49, al., cf. Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.215c ; ἐν ἐκκλήτῳ δικάσασθαι Michel 1335.30 ; δίκην ὠφληκὼς ἐν τῇ ἐ. IG 12(7).67.63 ( Amorgos) ; χρόνος ἔ. time-limit for appeals, PRev.Laws 21.15 (iii B.C.).
οἱ ἔκκλητοι, in Sparta and elsewhere, a committee of citizens chosen to report on certain questions, X. HG 2.4.38 ; ἔ. Ἀργείων ὄχλος E. Or. 612, cf. 949.

subject to appeal, δίκας IG 2(2).111.74, D.C. 52.22 ; κρίσις PHal. 1.68 (iii B.C.) ; τὰς ἐκκλήτους [ δίκας].. ἐφʼ αὑτὸν ποιούμενος, prob. for ἐγκ-, Arist. Oec. 1348b14 ; ἔκκλητον δικάζειν exercise appellate jurisdiction, D.C. 51.19.
movement to a flank, D.S. 20.12.
torture on the rack, EM 322.38 ; cf. κλῖμαξ.
inclined outwards, Arist. Phgn. 809b23 ; ὁ ἥλιος -έστερον ἡμῖν ποιεῖ τὸν κύκλον Id. Pr. 912a12.

data.quote: ὁ ἥλιος -έστερον ἡμῖν ποιεῖ τὸν κύκλον

children.definition: bend out of the regular line, bend outwards or away, opp. ἐγκλίνω, Hp. Art. 38 (s.v.l.) ; change the form of a word, Pl. Cra. 404d.
dislocate, Hp. Art. 7 ( Pass.).
embezzle, Dionys.Com. 3.10.
pervert, δικαιώματα LXX 1 Ki. 8.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: turn away, ἀπό τινος Th. 5.73, LXX Nu. 22.32(33) ; ἐκ τῆς ὁδοῦ ib. 23 ; ἐκ νόμου θεοῦ ib. Jb. 34.27 : abs., give ground, retire, X. Cyr. 1.4.23 ; give way, fall from its place, Id. Cyn. 6.10.
avoid, shun, ἐ. τι καὶ μὴ πράττειν Pl. Lg. 746c ; ἐπερχόμενον ἐ. νέφος Demad. 15 ; τὴν τῶν θηρίων ἔφοδον Plb. 1.34.4 ; στρατείαν Id. 5.42.4, etc.:— Pass., Epict. Ench. 2.

turn away or aside towards, κατά τι X. Cyr. 7.1.30 ; ἐπὶ τὰς ἔξω οἰκίας BGU 1215.9 (iii B.C.); ἐ. εἰς δῆμον, εἰς ὀλιγαρχίαν, decline into a democracy or oligarchy, Arist. Pol. 1273a5 ; πρός τινα visit a person on oneʼs journey, LXX Ge. 19.3.
turning out of oneʼs course, deflexion, τῆς σελήνης Plu. Fac.lun. 2.929c (pl.).
tendency, Arist. Pr. 863b24.

children.label: II
children.definition: dislocation, Hp. Art. 62.

children.label: III
children.definition: avoidance, refusal, opp. αἵρεσις, Cleanth.Stoic. 1.129 (pl.) ; opp. ἐκλογή, Stoic. 3.190 ; opp. ὄρεξις, Epict. Ench. 2 ; τῶν ὀχληρῶν S.E. M. 1.51 ; τῆς βλάβης Gal. 13.124, cf. Plot. 1.4.6, etc.

children.label: IV
children.definition: moral declension, ib. 8.15.
one must avoid, τὸν εὖ βάλλοντα τῶν πολεμίων Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.584d ; one must shun, τὰς ἀθρόας πόσεις Ath. 3.120d, cf. Menemach. ap. Orib. 7.22.3.
shirker, dub. word in D.L. 2.130.
disposed to decline or shirk, opp. ὀρεκτικός, δύναμις Arr. Epict. 1.1.12. Adv. - κῶς, ἔχειν πόνου ib. 3.12.7.
to be avoided, opp. ὀρεκτός, Simp. in Epict. p.109D., cf. Phot. s.v. παλιναίρετα.

wash out, wash away, τὴν βαφήν Pl. R. 430a ; τὸν ῥύπον Luc. Vit.Auct. 3 :—in Pass., Hp. Loc.Hom. 13 ; ἐ. τὰ λύματα εἰς τὸν Τίβεριν Str. 5.3.8 ; restored in ib. 1.7 ; to be washed ashore, εἰς τὸ ξηρόν Arist. HA 525a23.

data.quote: ἐ. τὰ λύματα εἰς τὸν Τίβεριν

children.definition: wash thoroughly, σῶμα Plu. Sull. 36 :— Med., Diocl. Fr. 141.

children.label: II
children.definition: stream out, Apollod. 1.6.3 (nisi leg. -έβλυσεν).
that which is washed away, τὸ τῆς ἡδονῆς ἔ. Plu. Suav. 2.1089b ; that which is washed up, produce of the sea, of purple dye, Zos.Alch. p.164B.
washed out, prob. in Eup. 147.
wear out: metaph. of troublesome loquacity, Theoc. 15.88 (in Dor. 3 pl. fut. ἐκκναισεῦντι).
scrape off, τὸν κηρὸν τοῦ δελτίου Hdt. 7.239, cf. Aen.Tact. 31.14 (prob.).
destroy, Call. Iamb. 1.199 :— Pass., Hsch. ; cf. κνημόω.
cheat by juggling tricks, cajole, dub. in Ar. Eq. 270.
pour out, Hsch. ; cf. ἐγκοακίσαι.
bake in an oven, Hsch.
hollow out, Plb. 10.48.7.
disembowel, Mithaec. ap. Ath. 7.325f.
sunken, ὀφθαλμός Hp. Int. 43 (fort. ἔγκοιλος).
sleep off the effects of a potion, Pl. Lg. 648a.
keep night-watch, bivouac, J. BJ 6.2.6.
night-watch, bivouac, in pl., Aen. Tact. 13.3, Ph. Bel. 93.5, D.S. 30.10.
Hsch.
Gloss.

definition: ἐκκοκκίζω, Att. fut. - ιῶ Ar. Lys. 364 :—

children.definition: take out kernels or seeds, e.g. from pomegranates, Apollon. ap. Gal. 12.649 : hence metaph., οὐσίδιον..ἐξεκόκκισα Nicom.Com. 3 ; ἐ. σφυρόν put out oneʼs ankle, Ar. Ach. 1179 ; ἐ. τὰς τρίχας pluck out the hair, Id. Lys. 448 ; ἐ. τὸ γῆρας drive away old age, ib. 364 ; ἐ. τὰς πόλεις sack, gut the cities, Id. Pax 63.
Hyp. Fr. 239.
erase, obliterate, τὸ ἐλεγεῖον Th. 1.132 ; τὸ ψήφισμα D. 57.64 ; τῆς ἐπιγραφῆς any part of.., CIG (add.) 4224d ( Anticragus), cf. Aristid. 1.425J.

children.label: II
children.definition: peck the chick out of the egg, hatch, Arist. HA 618a13 ; ἐ. τοὺς ἀνθρώπους Luc. VH 1.22 ; ἧπαρ Id. Prom. 9 :— Pass., Arist. HA 562a14 ; ᾠὸν ἐκκεκολαμμένον empty egg-shell, Thphr. HP 3.16.4 ; of a seam of ore, Gal. 12.239.
breaking the shell, of a chick, Arist. HA 561b29.
plunge into the sea from.., c. gen., ναός E. Hel. 1609 : abs., Ar. Fr. 80, cf. D.S. 20.86, Act.Ap. 27.42 ; swim ashore, εἰς τὴν γῆν D.H. 5.24, cf. App. Syr. 6.
removal, Hdt. 8.44 ; σίτου IG 2(2).655.12.

children.label: b
children.definition: purgation, τῶν περιττωμάτων Dsc. 4.176, cf.2.103.
burial, ἐ. πολυτελής D.H. 4.8, cf. AP 11.92 ( Lucill.), IG 12(7).395.27 ( Amorgos), IPE 12.34.5 ( Olbia, i B.C.).

carry or bring out, Hdt. 1.34, 3.24, E. Tr. 294 ; esp. to a place of safety, Hdt. 1.160, 3.122, Th. 2.6 ; ἐκκομίζειν τινὰ ἐκ τοῦ μέλλοντος γίνεσθαι πρήγματος to keep him out of trouble, Hdt. 3.43 :— Med., Id. 8.20, Th. 2.78 ; ἐσεκομίσαντο καὶ ἐξεκομίσαντο ἃ ἐβούλοντο, of those relieved from a state of siege, Id. 1.117 : abs., remove, ἐς τοὺς Λοκρούς Hdt. 8.32.
carry out a corpse, bury, Plb. 35.6.2 ( Pass.), Plu. Cic. 42 ( Pass.), etc.
ἐ. σῖτον, of a horse, throw the provender out of the manger, X. Eq. 4.2.
carry home, ἄνδρας Id. An. 6.6.36.

children.label: II
children.definition: endure to the end, τὸ πεπρωμένον E. Andr. 1269.

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., receive what is due, λόγους, ὀψώνια, PLille 3.79 (iii B. C.), PSI 4.436 (iii B. C.).
exportation, Str. 3.2.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: funeral, Phld. D. 1.25.
one who brings out, Gloss.
boast loudly, κατά τι S. El. 569.
set forth in fair terms, E. IA 333 (but prob. εὖ κεκόμψευσαι).
to be in the dust, Hp. Vict. 3.76 (nisi leg. ἐγκ-) ; cf. ἐκκεκονίσθαι· τὸ εἰς κονίαν ἀναλελύσθαι, Hsch.
a knife for excising, Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.11.6, Gal. 2.592, prob. in Paul.Aeg. 6.88.
cutting out, ὀφθαλμῶν Phld. Ir. p.33 W. ; excision of ribs, Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.11 tit.
mutilation, ἐ. μελῶν Vett.Val. 110.10 (pl.).
chiselling out, erasure, γραμμάτων SIG 252.41 ( Delph., iv B.C.) ; of an arrow-point from a bone, Plu. Alex. 63.

children.label: II
children.definition: cutting down, felling, δένδρων Plb. 2.65.6 (pl.), cf. BGU 1121.27 (i B.C.), etc. ; ἐκκοπαὶ λόφων levelling of hills, Str. 5.3.8 ; ἐ. πυλῶν Onos. 42.17.

children.label: III
children.definition: incision, notch, mortise, Ph. Bel. 65.20, Hero Aut. 27.1, Bel. 92.4, Ath.Mech. 30.3, Sor. 1.83.
weary, Thd. Is. 43.24.
discharge excrement, ἀθρόα πολλά Hp. Epid. 3.17.δʹ, cf. Hippiatr. 31.
empty of excrement, τὴν κοιλίην Hp. Acut.(Sp.) 71 (38), cf. Dieuch. ap. Orib. 4.8.11 :— Pass., Aret. CA 1.4.
cleansing from excrement: ἐ. τῆς κοιλίης emptying of the stomach by purging, Hp. Prog. 15.
promoting passage of faeces, Herod.Med. ap. Aët. 9.2, Suid. s.v. ἀλοή.
one must excise, Antyll. ap. Aët. 7.74 ; one must remove, τὴν αἰτίαν Gal. 10.662, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: one must cut to pieces, i.e. destroy, Plu. Luc. 24, Comp.Nic.Crass. 4.
one who excises, Gloss.
suitable for eradicating or expelling, τύλων, ὑγρῶν, Asclep. ap. Gal. 13.850, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 49.553.

cut out, knock out, τοὺς γομφίους Phryn.Com. 68 ; τῶν ἑρπετῶν ἐξέκοψε τὸ φθέγμα Call. Iamb. 1.163 :— Pass., ἢν..τωφθαλμὼʼ κκοπῇς have your eyes knocked out, Ar. Av. 342 ; τὸν ὀφθαλμὸν ἐκκεκομμένος D. 18.67 ; ἐξεκέκοπτο τὴν φωνήν had lost his voice, Luc. JTr. 16.

cut [trees] out of a wood, fell, Hdt. 6.37 ( Pass.), 9.97, Th. 6.99, etc. ; δένδρα ἐκκεκόφασι X. HG 6.5.37 ; παράδεισον laid waste the park, Id. An. 1.4.10 ; χωρία D.H. 8.87 ; νήσους καὶ πόλεις Plu. Pomp. 24 : hence,

children.label: b
children.definition: cut off, make an end of, τοὺς ἄνδρας Hdt. 4.110 ; ἐ. φενακισμόν, ἱεροσυλίαν, Din. 2.4, Is. 8.39 ; eradicate abuses, OGI 669.64 ( Egypt, i A.D.) ; τὴν αἰσθητικὴν ἐνέργειαν Arist. PA 656b5 ; extirpate, [ λύπας] Diog.Oen. 2 :— Pass., ἡ θρασύτης ἐξεκέκοπτο Pl. Chrm. 155c.

children.label: c
children.definition: ἐ. πλοῖα scuttle ships, IG 12(7).386.9 ( Amorgos).
beat off, repulse, τὰς ἀκροβολίσεις X. Cyr. 6.2.15 ; τοὺς ἐπὶ τῷ λόφῳ Id. HG 7.4.26.
win, in throwing the dice, Alex. 44, Menecr. 1 D.:— Pass., to be ruined at play, Hsch.
ἐ. θύρας break open, Lys. 3.6 ; οἰκίαν ἐ. Plb. 4.3.10.

cut out or erase an inscription, SIG 38.38 (Teos, V B.C.), Arist. Rh. 1400a33 ; οὐδενὶ ἐξέσται..γράμμα ἐκκόψαι CIG 3028 ( Ephesus), al. ; ἐ. τὴν χεῖρα Ev.Matt. 5.30 ; cut out, as a surgeon does, Luc. Cat. 24.
coin, stamp money, D.S. 11.26.

children.label: b
children.definition: φαντασίαν ἐ. ὡς.. Phld. Lib. p.56 O. ; γένη οὐκ ἐκκοπτόμενα ἰδίοις τέλεσι genders not marked by different terminations, A.D. Synt. 104.23 ; ἐ. ἀναφθέγματα coin expressions, Phld. D. 3.14.
hinder, bring to a stop, PAlex. 4.1 (iii B.C.), Vett.Val. 268.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: pause, come to a stop, Id. 260.24.

definition: ἐκκορακίζω, in Suid., Zonar., perh. f.l. for ἐσκορακίζω or σκορακίζω.

children.definition: sweep clean, τὰς κλίνας Thphr. Char. 22.12 (nisi leg. ἐκκορίσας): metaph., μὴ ʼκκόρει τὴν Ἑλλάδα Ar. Pax 59 ; and (with a play on κόρη) τίς ἐξεκόρησέ σε; who has robbed you of your daughter? Id. Th. 760 : generally, sweep away, τὸν τῦφον, τὴν κραιπάλην, Alciphr. 1.37 ; ἐκκορηθείης σύ γε clear out! pack off! Men. Georg. 53 : prov., ἐκκόρει, κόρη, κορώνην maiden, drive away the crow— the opening of a wedding song—the crow being a prognostic of widowhood, Carm.Pop. 25, cf. Horap. 1.8.
to clear of bugs, AP 9.113 ( Parmen.), cf.foreg.

children.label: II
children.definition: κόρη) sens. obsc., Eup. 233.
tell a tale summarily, state the main points, Hes. Op. 106 :— Pass., ἐκκεκορύφωται ὁ λόγος Hp. Morb. 4.48.
deck out, adorn, in Pass., LXX 4 Ma. 6.2, Aristid. 1.148 J.
decoration, v.l. for κόσμησις, Dsc. 5.94.
pf. part. Pass. -κεκοττισμένος ruined at play, Hsch. s.v. ἐκκεκομμένος.
having a dislocated hip, Gloss.
raise up, exalt, Plu. Mar. 9.

children.label: II
children.definition: relieve pain, etc., Id. Crass. 33 (v.l.), Ruf. Fr. 117.

children.label: III
children.definition: weigh anchor, Ael. Fr. 71.
shout, ἤκουσα τῶν ἐκκραγγανομένων Men. 22 D.
cry out, κυνηδὸν ἐξέκραξαν cj. in S. Fr. 722 ; ἐ. μέγα Plu. Mar. 44 ; ἐ. πολλὰ κυνηδόν D.C. 66.15.
Epicur. Fr. 605.
hang, be suspended, v.l. in Hp. Art. 76 ; τὴν γυναῖκα ἐκκρεμαμένην ἀποσεισάμενος Luc. Tox. 61 : c. gen., hang from, Pl. Ion 536a.

children.label: II
children.definition: depend upon, ἐξ ἐπιθυμιῶν Id. Lg. 732e ; τῆς τοῦ ζῆν ἐπιθυμίας Plu. Mar. 12 ; ἐλπίδος AP 9.411 ( Maec.).
hang from or upon a thing, Hp. Art. 22 (dub.) ; τι ἔκ τινος Ar. Eq. 1363 ; λίθον τοῦ ποδός AP 11.100 ( Lucill.) ; τινὰ ἐξ Ὀλύμπου Apollod. 1.3.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., like ἐκκρέμαμαι, hang on by, cling to, c. gen., τῶν τε ξυσκήνων ἤδη ἀπιόντων ἐκκρεμαννύμενοι Th. 7.75, cf. Luc. Tox. 6.

data.quote: τῶν τε ξυσκήνων ἤδη ἀπιόντων ἐκκρεμαννύμενοι

children.definition: to be devoted to, Ἄρεος E. El. 950.
hanging from or upon, v.l. in Hp. Art. 76.

suspended, πήρα Hdn. 1.9.3 ; τὸ -ές the lobe of the ear, Ruf. Onom. 43 : c. gen., hanging from or upon, χείλεος AP 5.246 ( Maced.) ; ἐπί τινι ib. 240.8 ( Paul.Sil.) ; ἀπὸ τοῦ ὤμου Agath. 3.17 ; ἐπὶ γαστέρα ἐ. προβάλλειν Aret. CA 1.5, cf. Porph. Gaur. 3.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -μῶς, Gramm., in dependent construction, opp. ἀπολύτως, Eust. 1752.47.

v.l. in Hp. Art. 76 : c. gen., E. HF 520 ; ῥόπτρων χέρας ἐκκρημνάμεσθα we hang on to the doorknocker by the hands, Id. Ion 1612 :—later in Act. part. ἐκκρημνάς or -κριμνάς hanging up, Iamb. VP 33.238.
apart, alone, prob.l. in Tryph. 224.
secretion, Thphr. Ign. 76.
single out, Th. 6.96 :— Pass., ἀρετῆ πρῶτος ἐκκριθείς S. Ph. 1425, cf. Th. 6.31.
separate, Arist. HA 578a11, 572b22 ( Pass.) ; ἐκ τοῦ μείγματος ἐκκρίνουσι τἆλλα hold that the rest are separated out from.., Id. Ph. 187a23.
exclude, expel, X. Cyr. 1.2.14 ( Act. and Pass.), Luc. Salt. 3 ( Pass.) ; reject, condemn, Gal. 18(2).693.

secrete, of the animal functions, Arist. GA 765b10, al. ; τραῦμα ἐ. ἰχῶρας Zen. 6.46 :—freq. in Pass., Arist. GA 738a1, al. ; ἐκ πυρὸς -κρινόμενον καπνόν given off by.., Phld. Sign. 36 : metaph., ὅταν..καθαρὸς ὁ νοῦς ἐκκριθῇ X. Cyr. 8.7.20.
Pass., also of excretions, Hp. Aph. 4.47, 76, etc.
remove, λίθους Dsc. 2.127.
separation, Arist. Mete. 342a15, Onos. 9.1 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: secretion, of the animal functions, Arist. PA 689a16, GA 727a2 ; τῶν ὑγρῶν Eun. Hist. p.263 D.

children.label: III
children.definition: Hp. Aph. 2.15 ; of the menses, Arist. HA 583a2, etc.
one must pick out, Pl. Plt. 303b.
secretive, Arist. Ph. 243b14 ; τῆς θερμότητος Thphr. CP 6.1.3.
tending to remove, φυσῶν Dsc. 2.152.

picked out, select, ἔ. δεκάς a chosen ten, A. Pers. 340 ; πλῆθος ἔ. στρατοῦ ib. 803, cf. Th. 57 ; ἔ. δικασταί Pl. Lg. 926d ; ἔ. δώρημα, = ἐξαίρετον, S. Aj. 1302 ; ἔ. ἄλλων A.R. 4.1185 ; ἔ. νομίζεσθαι Philostr. Gym. 23 : neut. ἔκκριτον, as Adv., above all, eminently, E. Tr. 1241.
evacuated, Arist. Pr. 861a36.
beat or knock out, ὅπλα τῆς χειρός J. AJ 6.2.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: hammer out, form, educate, Phryn. PS p.68 B.
gush forth, Sch. Il. 20.470.
beating out, driving away, X. Cyn. 10.12.

children.label: II
children.definition: deduction, PTeb. 121.133 (i B.C.).
waning of the moon, ἐ. καὶ μείωσις Paul.Al. G. 4.
fitted for expelling, τοῦ ἐλέου Arist. Rh. 1386a22 ; τοῦ λόγου Arr. Epict. 2.18.29.
beaten out, embossed, A. Th. 542.
knock out, παττάλους Ar. Fr. 402b ; τι ἐκ τῶν χειρῶν X. Cyn. 10.12 ; for Ar. Fr. 270 ( Med.), v. πύνδαξ :— Pass., BGU 1007.16 (iii B.C.).

children.label: b
children.definition: ἡ μείζων κίνησις ἐ. τὴν ἐλάττω expels, Arist. Sens. 447a15 ; [ ἡ ἡδίων ἐνέργεια] ἐ. τὴν ἑτέραν Id. EN 1175b8 ; ἐ. τὸν λογισμόν, τὴν λύπην, ib. 1119b10, 1154a27.

data.quote: ἡ μείζων κίνησις ἐ. τὴν ἐλάττω

children.definition: drive back, repulse, Th. 4.131, X. HG 7.4.16 ; ἀπὸ [ λόφου] Th. 4.128 : metaph., ἐ. τινὰ ἐλπίδος to frustrate, cheat one of. ., Pl. Phdr. 228e ; τῆς προαιρέσεως Plu. Sol. 14 ; ἵνα μὴ.. τοῦ παρόντος ἐμαυτὸν ἐκκρούσω D. 18.313 :— Pass., τὸν λογισμὸν ἐκκρουσθείς Plu. Pyrrh. 30.

data.quote: ἵνα μὴ.. τοῦ παρόντος ἐμαυτὸν ἐκκρούσω

children.definition: hiss an actor off the stage, ἐβόων, ἐξέκρουόν με D. 19.23.

put off, adjourn by evasions, εἰς ὑστεραίαν τὴν.. γνώμην ib. 144 ; [ τὴν δίκην] Id. 36.2, cf. 54.30 ; τοσαύτας τέχνας.. εὑρίσκων ἐκκρούει Id. 21.81 ; ἐ. τοὺς λόγους elude, Pl. Prt. 336c ; ἐ. πρᾶγμα τῷ χρόνῳ ‘talk out’, Plu. Caes. 13 :— Pass., γραφῆς ἐκκρουομένης D. 45.4.
discharge, βέλη ἐκ μηχανῶν D.C. 75.11.
subtract, κοινὸν ἐκκεκρούσθω τὸ ἀπὸ BZ let the square on BZ be subtracted from both, Papp. 946.16 ; cast out by division, Vett.Val. 20.20, 174.2 ; deduct, in Pass., PTeb. 189, 241 (i B.C.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., get rid of, βῆχα Plu. Garr. 2.515a.

children.label: III
children.definition: break forth, κέρατα τῶν κροτάφων ἐκκρούει Philostr. VA 1.19.
burst forth with noise, of thunder, Poll. 1.118.
play at dice: metaph., ἐ. τοῖς ὅλοις, ὑπὲρ τῶν ὅλων, to stake oneʼs all, Phylarch. 58 J., Plb. 1.87.8, cf. 3.94.4: c.acc., τὴν ἄδηλον τύχην Onos. 32.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be gambled out of, lose at play, χιλίους ἐκκυβευθεῖσα δαρεικούς Plu. Art. 17.
tumble headlong out of, δίφρων ἐς κρᾶτα πρὸς γῆν ἐκκυβιστώντων βίᾳ E. Supp. 692 ; ἐ. ὑπέρ τινος to throw a somersault over a thing, of dancers, X. Smp. 2.11, cf. An. 6.1.9.

data.quote: δίφρων ἐς κρᾶτα πρὸς γῆν ἐκκυβιστώντων βίᾳ

children.definition: bring forth, put forth as leaves, AP 7.385 ( Phil.).

wheel out, esp. by means of the ἐκκύκλημα (q.v.), ἀλλʼ ἐκκυκλήθητι come, wheel yourself out! i.e. show yourself, Ar. Ach. 408 ; Answ., ἀλλʼ ἐκκυκλήσομαι ib. 409 ; ποῖός ἐστιν ; Answ., οὗτος οὑκκυκλούμενος Id. Th. 96 ; ἐφʼ ὑψηλῆς μηχανῆς ἐ. τὴν φιλοσοφίαν Phi- lostr. VA 6.11.
publish, divulge, τι εἰς ἀγοράν Plu. Profect. 2.80a : f.l. for ἐκκλίνω in D.H. Rh. 10.9.
theatrical machine, used to display an interior, Poll. 4.128.

roll out, ᾤʼ ἐκκυλίνδων Ar. Pax 134 : mostly in aor. I, σε καταιγίδες ἐξεκύλῑσαν.. γυμνὸν ἐπʼ ἠϊόνι AP 7.501 ( Pers.), cf. 582 ( Jul.); overthrow, πίτυν.. γαίης ἐξεκύλισε ib. 9.131 ; ἐξεκύλισε βίην ib. 543 ( Phil.):— Pass., S. OT 812: elsewh. aor.1, ἐκ δίφροιο.. ἐξεκυλίσθη he rolled headlong from the chariot, Il. 6.42, 23.394, cf. AP 11.399 ( Apollinar.); but ἐκκυλισθέντος τοῦ τροχοῦ Pherecyd. 37 (a) J.; plunge headlong, εἰς ἔρωτας love-intrigues, v.l. for ἐγκυλίνδω, X. Mem. 1.2.22, cf. Opp. H. 4.20; γένος εἰς κακίαν ἐσχώτην ἐκκεκυλισμένον Max.Tyr. 30.3.

data.quote: σε καταιγίδες ἐξεκύλῑσαν.. γυμνὸν ἐπʼ ἠϊόνι

children.definition: extricate, ὅστις δὴ τρόπος ἐξεκύλισέ νιν Pi. Fr. 7, cf. AP 7.176 ( Antiphil.):— Pass., to be extricated from, ὅτῳ τρόπῳ τῆσδʼ ἐκκυλισθήσει τύχης A. Pr. 87; ἐκκυλισθῆναι ἐκ δικτύων X. Cyn. 8.8, cf. Plu. Galb. 27.
Pass., to be published abroad, εἰς ἀγοράν Id. Garr. 2.507e.
to be unrolled, Arist. Mech. 855a30, al., S.E. M. 3.75, al.
a garland closely wreathed or rolled together, Archipp. 40, etc.
swerve, bulge from the straight line, of a line of soldiers, X. An. 1.8.18, cf. Demetr. Eloc. 84.
cause to burst from their sockets, τὤμματα Herod. 6.68.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be cast up by the waves, D.H. 10.53 ; ὑπὸ τῆς θαλάσσης Plu. Isid. 2.357a.
breaking of waves on a beach, Eust. 31.45.
to be cast up by the waves, Str. 6.3.9.
keep questing about, X. Cyn. 3.10, Poll. 5.65:—also ἐκκῠνόω, ibid.
track out, S. Ichn. 75.
pursue in the chase, hunt down, τινά E. Ion 1422, prob. in A. Eu. 231.
one must chase, ἀρχάς Dam. Pr. 45.
questing about, X. Cyn. 7.10, Poll. 5.65.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἔκκυνοι· νόσημά τι κυνῶν, Hsch.

peep out of, αἰγείρου Babr. 50.13 ; ἐκ τῶν οἴκων Ant.Lib. 39.6; ἐκκύψασαν ἁλῶναι to be caught peeping out (Reiske for ἐγκ-), Ar. Th. 790: generally, pop out, Id. Ec. 1052 ; of a snailʼs eyes, Teucer ap. Ath. 10.455e : metaph., proceed forth, τοῦ νοητοῦ εἰς οὐρανόν Plot. 4.3.15; cf. ἐκκέκυφεν· ἀνωρθώθη ( -ωσεν cod.), Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: put forth, Ael. NA 15.21.
make curved, in Pass., Philostr.Jun. Im. 12 (nisi leg. ἐγκ-).
proclaim by a bell, publish abroad, Ath. 5.219b.
rush wildly out, εἰς ἄλλην χθόνα E. Andr. 603.
furnish with oars, or generally, equip, fit out: ἐκκεκώπηται S. Fr. 145 ap. Hsch.

deafen, stun, τὰς Ἀθήνας ἐκκεκώφηκας βοῶν Ar. Eq. 312 : — Pass., αἱ δέ μευ φρένες ἐκκεκωφέαται Anacr. 81 : metaph., ἐς τὸ κάλλος ἐκκεκώφηται ξίφη are blunted at the sight of.., E. Or. 1288, cf. sq. [ἐκκωφόω]
make quite deaf, τὰ ὦτα Pl. Ly. 204c:— Pass., become so, Luc. Nav. 10, etc.; πρὸς τὸ κάλλος Ath. 5.188c; ἐς κάλλος (v. foreg.) Ael. NA 1.38, v.l. in E. Or. 1288.
amount contracted for, IG 12(5).647.19 ( Ceos, ἐγλ-).

definition: ἐκλαγχάνω, pf. ἐκλέλογχα condemned by Luc. Sol. 5 :—

children.definition: obtain by lot or fate, ὅπως πατρῴας τύμβον ἐκλάχῃ χθονός S. El. 760; τὸν αὐτὸν δαίμονʼ ἐξειληχότες Id. OC 1337 ; κακῶν μέρος ἐξέλαχον Ar. Th. 1071.
kick out, fling out behind, σκέλος οὐράνιον Ar. V. 1492 ; τὸ Φρυνίχειον ἐ. ib. 1525 : abs., Eup. 411, Hp. Art. 82.
escape, run away, Men. 16; also εἰς κραιπάλην Procop. Pers. 1.24.
dance, in which the legs are thrown up behind, fling, Poll. 4.102.
blurt out, blab, divulge, D. 1.26, Ph. 1.64, al., Aen.Gaz. Ep. 7 ; τὸ ἐκλαλοῦν talkativeness, E. Fr. 219 :— Pass., Hp. Jusj. 1, Lib. Or. 18.213.
uttering, condemned by Poll. 5.147.
capable of expressing, Diocl. ap. D.L. 7.49.
receive from others, ἀριστεῖʼ ἐκλαβὼν στρατεύματος having received the meed of valour from them, S. Ph. 1429; ἐ. νόμους to accept laws from another, Plb. 2.39.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: seize and carry off, βίᾳ τοὺς παῖδας Isoc. l.c.; ἐ. μέρος τι [ τῆς μητρός] Arist. GA 753b34 : generally, remove, καρπόν PRev.Laws 29.13 (iii B.C.), etc.: Medic., evacuate, πύον Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.10.7; dissect out, Antyll. ap. Orib. 7.14.5.

children.label: III
children.definition: receive in full, Isoc. Ep. 6.13 ; ἐ. τι παρά τινος E. Ion 1335, Isoc. 5.100, Pl. Lg. 958d ; τὸ τέλεον καὶ ἱκανόν τινων ib. 807d.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἔργα ἐ., = ἐργολαβέω, contract to do work, Hdt. 9.95, cf. PMagd. 10.1 (iii B.C.), IG 12(5).647 ( Ceos), etc.: c. inf., ἐ. παρὰ τῆς πόλεως πίνακα γράψαι Plu. Pel. 25, cf. 2.396e.

data.quote: ἐ. παρὰ τῆς πόλεως πίνακα γράψαι

children.definition: hire, ὀρχήστριαν PGrenf. 2.67.5 (iii A.D.).

children.label: V
children.definition: take in a certain sense, understand, ἐ. τοὺς νόμους οὕτω Lys. 11.6 ; ἐ. τι ἐπὶ τὸ χεῖρον Arist. Rh. 1416b11; διχῶς Id. APr. 32b26.
take note of, σηκώματα Nicom. Harm. 6; ἐ. ἀντίγραφον take a copy, PGen. 74.8 (iii A.D.).

children.label: VI
children.definition: select, τὰς προτάσεις Arist. APr. 43b1; τὰ χαλεπώτατα Longin. 10.3.

children.label: VII
children.definition: Med., ἐκλαμβάνομαι, = ὑπολογίζομαι, Din. Fr. 16.4.
take hold of, c. gen., Ph. 1.134.

children.label: VIII
children.definition: Pass., to be picked out, adorned, φιάλαις λιθοκολλήτοις Agatharch. 102.
very bright, φλόγες LXX Wi. 17.5, cf. Sch. Arat. 169 : neut. as Adv., ἔκλαμπρον γελᾶν Ath. 4.158d. Regul. Adv. -ρως brilliantly, Annuario 3.151 (Pisidia, ἐγλ-lapis).
polish up, Herod. 7.12 (tm.): adorn, τὸ ἱερὸν κατασκευῇ ἀναθημάτων J. BJ 7.3.3, cf. Max.Tyr. 22.2 :— Pass., to be adorned, πόλιν τούτοις -υνθεῖσαν D.H. 2.3.

shine or beam forth, Hdt. 6.82, A. Pr. 1083 (anap.); ὅπλα ὥστε κάτοπτρον ἐξέλαμπεν X. Cyr. 7.1.2, etc.; ὀμμάτων ἐ. πόθος APl. 16.182 ( Leon.); ὥσπερ ἀστραπήν Hp. Epid. 7.88; πῦρ ἐκ λίθων ἐ. Arist. HA 516b11 : metaph., δίκας δʼ ἐξέλαμψε θεῖον φάος Trag.Adesp. 500; ὥσπερ ἐκ πυρείων ἐ. Pl. R. 435a; ἐξ. ἡ δόξα Plb. 31.23.2 ; of persons, Ph. 1.326, al.; burst forth violently, of a fever, Hp. VM 16 ; of sound, to be clearly heard, [ ἐκ τῆς κραυγῆς] ἐξέλαμψε τὸ καλεῖν τὸν βασιλέα Plb. 15.31.1.
to be distinguished, διʼ εὐφυΐαν Plu. Cic. 2; τῶν ἄλλων Lib. Or. 62.37.

children.label: II
children.definition: flash forth, πυρωπὸν γλῆνος ἐκλάμψαν φλόγα A. Fr. 300.4; σέλας dub.l. in E. Fr. 330, cf. Lyc. 1091 ; πῦρ App. Syr. 56, cf. Bias Fr.Lyr.: metaph., νοῦς ἐ. αἰσθήσεις Ph. 1.72 ; ἀπὸ τοῦ ἑνὸς ὁ θεὸς ἑαυτὸν ἐξέλαμψε Iamb. Myst. 8.2.

data.quote: ἀπὸ τοῦ ἑνὸς ὁ θεὸς ἑαυτὸν ἐξέλαμψε

children.label: III
children.definition: PLond. 1.132.95 (i/ii A.D.).
shining forth, brightness, LXX 2 Ma. 5.3; ἡλίου Olymp. in Mete. 49.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: sudden development, at puberty, Hp. Epid. 6.114 ( ἐκλάμψιας (acc. pl.) ap. Gal. ad loc.).

escape notice utterly:— Med., forget utterly, c. gen. rei, ἐκ χόλω τῶδε λαθοίμεθα Alc. Supp. 23.9; τοῦδʼ ἐκλανθάνει thou forgettest this entirely, S. OC 1005 ; ἐγλαθόμενος τῆς εὐθύνης POxy. 1203.8 (i A.D.), cf. Ph. 1.247, al.; ἐ. ὅτι.. Pl. Ax. 369e.

children.label: II
children.definition: pres. ἐκληθάνω, with aor. 1 ἐξέλησα, Aeol. ἐξέλᾱσα (v. infr.): Ep. redupl. aor. 2 ἐκλέλᾰθον:

Act., make one quite forgetful of a thing, c.gen. rei, ἐκ δέ με πάντων ληθάνει ὅσσʼ ἔπαθον Od. 7.220 ; ἔκ μʼ ἔλᾱσας ἀλγέων Alc. 95 : c. acc. rei, ἐκλέλαθον κιθαριστύν made him quite forget his harping, Il. 2.600 : abs., Ἀΐδας ὁ ἐκλελάθων (redupl. pres.) Theoc. 1.63.

data.quote: ἐκ δέ με πάντων ληθάνει ὅσσʼ ἔπαθον

children.definition: Med. and Pass., forget utterly, ὀϊζύος ἐκλελαθέσθαι Il. 6.285 ; ἀικῆς ἐξελάθοντο 16.602 ; ὡς ἐκλέλησμαί γʼ ἃ πάρος εἴπομεν E. Ba. 1272 : c. inf., ἐκλάθετο..καταβῆναι Od. 10.557 ; λελάθοντο.., οὐ μὰν ἐκλελάθοντʼ Sapph. 93.

data.quote: ὡς ἐκλέλησμαί γʼ ἃ πάρος εἴπομεν

children.definition: cast out from, ἑδωλίων A. Th. 456 (lyr.).
drink off, Id. Ach. 1229, etc.
hew in stone, LXX Nu. 21.18; hew or hollow out, ib. De. 6.11 :— Pass., Str. 7 Fr. 35.

children.label: II
children.definition: quarry stones from, τὴν γῆν Jul. Gal. 135c.
dig or hollow out, A.R. 1.374, Tryph. 208.
cut vegetables, Thphr. HP 7.11.3.
smooth out or away, ῥυτίδας Pl. Smp. 191a : hence, abolish, cause to disappear, Hp. Prorrh. 2.20 ( Pass.), Plu. Vind. 2.567f.
smooth or polish off, [ λίθον] Agatharch. 82 ; ἐ. τὰ φαντάσματα smooth them down, Plu. Profect. 2.83c.
attrition, ἐντέρων Orib. Fr. 56, cf. Aët. 9.43.

definition: ἐκλέγω, fut. Pass. ἐκλεγήσεσθαι IG 1(2).76.16 : pf. Pass. ἐξείλεγμαι Pl. Alc. 1.121e, and in med. sense, D. 20.131, but ἐκλέλεγμαι Diph. 44, Posidipp. 27.9 (prob.):—

children.definition: pick or single out, Th. 4.59, etc.; esp. of soldiers, rowers, etc., X. HG 1.6.19, Pl. R. 535a; ἐκ πάντων κεφάλαια Id. Lg. 811a:— Pass., Id. Alc. l.c.; ἐκλελεγμένος select, recondite, Diog. Oen.23 :— Med., pick out for oneself, choose, Hdt. 1.199, 3.38, D. l.c.; τὰ κάλλιστα Pl. Smp. 198d, al.; ἐξ ἁπάντων Isoc. 9.58.
select, λέξεις καλάς D.H. Comp. 3; cf. ἐκλογή.
Med., of God, elect, choose, LXX De. 4.37, Ep.Eph. 1.4, etc.
ἐκλέγειν τὰς πολιὰς (sc. τρίχας) pull out oneʼs grey hairs, Ar. Eq. 908, Fr. 410.

children.label: II
children.definition: levy taxes or tribute, χρήματα παρά τινος Th. 8.44 ; τὰς ἐπικαρπίας And. 1.92, cf. IG 1(2).76.8 ( Pass., ib. 16) ; ἔκ τινων D. 49.49 ; take toll of, χαλκοῦς Thphr. Char. 6.4 : c. acc. pers., ἐ. τέλη τοὺς καταπλέοντας Aeschin. 3.113 : c.acc. et gen., τὴν δεκάτην τῶν πλοίων X. HG 1.1.22.

children.label: III
children.definition: declare, Prisc. p.294D., Gloss.
Gloss.
medicine that melts in the mouth, lozenge or jujube, Aret. CA 1.5, Dsc. 2.158 (pl.), Archig. ap. Orib. 8.2.27, Sor. 1.123.
of the consistency required for a lozenge, Aët. 3.111, 12.67.
made into a lozenge, v.l. in Hp. Acut. (Sp.) 30.
to powder very fine, Dsc. Ther. 19 ( Pass.).
rub down or to pieces, Alcx.Trail.7.5, Steph. in Hp. 1.156D.
failure, lack, πίστεως J. AJ 19.4.6.
we must omit, Aristid. Or. 43(1).3.

of or caused by an eclipse, σελήνης χρόνοι Hipparch. 3.5.1a; πανσέληνοι Plu. Coniug. 2.145c; ἐπισκοτήσεις ib. Fac.lun. 932a; συγκρίσεις ἡλίου καὶ σελήνης Str. 1.1.12 ; ἀριθμός dub. in Doroth. ap. Heph.Astr. 3.20; ἐκλειπτικόν, τό, part of moonʼs orbit in which eclipses take place, Gem. 11.6, cf. Paul.Al. O. 2; ἐ. ζῴδιον, τόπος, Vett.Val. 5.28, 7.10, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: ὁ ἐ. (sc. κύκλος) ecliptic, = ὁ ἡλιακός, so called because it is the circle in the plane of which the sun and moon must be to produce eclipses, interpol. in Cleom. 2.5, Ach.Tat. Intr.Arat. 23.

children.label: III
children.definition: elliptical, Pall. in Hp. 2.145D.

leave out, pass over, πολλὰ δʼ ἐκλείπω λέγων A. Pers. 513; ἐ. ὄχλον λόγων Id. Pr. 827, cf. D. 25.47; ἐ. Ἄνδρον leave out, pass over Andros, Hdt. 4.33; ἐ. ὁτιοῦν τῆς παρασκευῆς Th. 7.48 ; τὴν στρατιάν X. HG 5.2.22 ; εἴ τι ἐξέλιπον, σὸν ἔργον ἀναπληρῶσαι Pl. Smp. 188e :— Pass., ὄνειδος οὐκ ἐκλείπεται fails not to appear, A. Eu. 97.

data.quote: εἴ τι ἐξέλιπον, σὸν ἔργον ἀναπληρῶσαι

children.definition: forsake, desert, abandon, τὰς πατρίδας, τὴν ξυμμαχίην, etc., Hdt. 1.169, 6.13, etc.; θήρας μόχθον E. Hipp. 52; τὸ ξυνώμοτον Th. 2.74; τὸν ὅρκον E. IT 750; abandon, quit, τὴν τάξιν Hdt. 8.24, al.; τὴν χώρην Id. 4.105, 118, al.; τὸν πλοῦν S. Ph. 911, cf. 58; give up, τὴν τυραννίδα Hdt. 6.123; τὰ ὑπάρχοντα Th. 1.144; θρήνους E. Ph. 1635; v. infr. II.2.
ἐκλείπειν τὴν πόλιν εἰς τὰ ἄκρα abandon the city and go to the heights, Hdt. 6.100, cf. 8.50, X. An. 7.4.2; ἐξέλειπον οἴκους πρὸς ἄλλον εὐνάτορα E. Andr. 1040 (lyr.).
εἴ τις ἐξέλιπε τὸν ἀριθμόν (of the Persian immortals) if any one left the number incomplete, Hdt. 7.83.
fail one, ἐκλελοίπασιν ὑμᾶς αἱ προφάσεις Lys. 8.16, cf. Pl. Lg. 657d.

children.label: II
children.definition: suffer eclipse, Th. 2.28 ; in full, ὁ ἥλιος ἐκλιπὼν τὴν ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ ἕδρην Hdt. 7.37; ἐ. τὰς ὁδούς Ar. Nu. 584.

data.quote: ὁ ἥλιος ἐκλιπὼν τὴν ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ ἕδρην

children.definition: die, οἱ ἐκλιπόντες the deceased, Pl. Lg. 856e; τῶν ἄλλων ἐκλελοιπότων Is. 11.10, etc.; of trees, BGU 1120.33 (i B.C.); more freq. in full, ἐ. βίον S. El. 1131; ὑφʼ ὧν ἥκιστα ἐχρῆν τὸν βίον ἐκλιπών (= ἀποθανών) Antipho 1.21; so ἐ. φάος E. Ion 1186, etc.
faint, Hp. Prorrh. 1.71.

leave off, cease, τῇ μοι [ ὁ λόγος] ἐξέλιπε Hdt. 7.239; ἐ. πυρετός Hp. Aph. 4.56, cf. Th. 3.87; ἐκλέλοιπεν εὐφρόνη, i.e. it is day, S. El. 19; ὥστε μὴ ʼκλιπεῖν κλέος ib. 985, cf. 1149; [ αἱ ἐργασίαι] ἐκλελοίπασιν Isoc. 8.20: c. part., leave off doing, Pl. Mx. 234b, cf. 249b: c. gen., θεραπείας Plu. Marc. 17.

fail, be wanting, ῥώμη γὰρ ἐκλέλοιπεν ἣν πρὶν εἴχομεν E. HF 230, cf. Pl. R. 485d; τῶν ἐπιτηδείων ἐκλειπόντων D.S. 16.75; ἡ φωνὴ ἐξέλιπε Luc. Nigr. 35; περὶ ὧν ἐ. [ὁ νόμος] Arist. Pol. 1286a37: Gramm., of words in a sentence, A.D. Synt. 11.17; of grammatical forms, ib. 168.21.

data.quote: ῥώμη γὰρ ἐκλέλοιπεν ἣν πρὶν εἴχομεν

children.definition: remain, be left, LXX 4 Ki. 7.13.
depart, A. Pers. 128 (lyr.), Th. 219.
ἐκλείπων σφυγμός remittent pulse, Gal. 9.66.
lick up, of taking honey, Hp. Acut. 56, cf. Ph. 1.458, 527: — Pass., to be taken as an ἐκλεικτόν, Dsc. 1.72,2.158.
abandonment, νεῶν, πολίων, Hdt. 6.25, 7.37; τῆς πατρίδος D.C. 41.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: eclipse, ἡλίου ἐκλείψεις Th. 1.23, cf. Arist. Metaph. 1044b10, etc.; ἔ. τελεία, μερική, Cleom. 2.6; εἰλικρινής ib. 5: metaph. (with play on I), βασιλέως Plb. 29.16.1, cf. Plu. Aem. 17.
failing, cessation, τῶν δυνάμεων Id. Def.orac. 2.433f (pl.), cf. Aret. SD 1.7; extinction of a race, Str. 9.5.12.
defect, omission, Id. 5.3.7.
failing to appear in court, AB 259.
ἔκλειψις χορίου retention of the afterbirth, Paul.Aeg. 6.75.
to be picked out, selected, Pl. R. 456b, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐκλεκτέον one must select, ib. 412d, Arist. APr. 43b6, Sor. 1.78.
capable of exercising moral choice, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.46.
ἐ. ἀξία value deserving such choice, Antip. ib. 30, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: picking out, selective, δυνάμεις D.H. Comp. 2 fin.; οἱ ἐ. the Eclectics, philosophers who selected such doctrines as pleased them in every school, Gal. 14.684; ἐ. αἵρεσις D.L. Prooem. 21, Gal. 19.353.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -κῶς Hierocl. p.41A.
picked out, select, Ibyc. 22, Th. 6.100; τὸ τῶν ἐ. δικαστήριον Pl. Lg. 938b; ἐ. δικασταί,=Lat. iudices selecti, OGI 499.3 (ii A.D.). Adv. - τῶς interpol. in Suid. s.v. ἐπίλεκτος.
choice, pure, σμύρνη LXX Ex. 30.23; βοήθημα Asclep. ap. Aët. 9.12; ἀνδρών PRein. 43.9 (ii A.D.); ἐκλεκτόν,= corn, Aq. Ps. 64(65).14.

children.label: II
children.definition: chosen of God, elect, LXX Is. 43.20, Ev.Marc. 13.20, etc.
to be separated, i.e. purified, LXX Is. 52.11.

definition: ἐκλελαμμένον ἐξεστραμμένον, Hsch. ἐκλελαπτημένον· ἐκπεπονημένον, Id. ἐκλελι<α>σμένος· ἐξεστραμμένος, Id.
ἐκλελυμένως, Adv. pf. part. Pass. of ἐκλύω,

children.definition: loosely, carelessly, Isoc. Ep. 6.6; ἐ. καὶ ἀτόνως Plu. Lyc. 18; freely, licentiously, Ath. 12.519f.
peel, rind, Hp. Morb. 2.13.
selection, choice, Pl. Phdr. 231d
Hp. Nat.Puer. 29 ( Pass.), Ph. 1.345 (quoting Ge. 30.37, where LXX λεπίζω).
taking off the shell: hatching, Suid. s.v. νεοττεία.
make λεπρός, in Pass., Sch. Theoc. 1.40.
very thin, οὖρον Hp. Coac. 572.
make very thin, f.l. for - πλύνω, Gp. 16.6.3; reduce to a fine state, τὰς οὐσίας Syn.Alch.p.58B.
strip off the bark: metaph., strip, Sophr. 22.

free from shell or rind, peel, κόκκους Hp. Mul. 1.81, 84; of crocodiles and birds, hatch their young, Hdt. 2.68, Cratin. 108, cf. Ar. Av. 1108; of serpents, Hdt. 3.109; of insects and tortoises, Arist. HA 553a8, 558a10:— Pass., fut. ἐκλᾰπήσομαι v.l. (ap. Erot.) in Hp. Nat.Puer. 29: aor. ἐκλᾰπῆναι Ar. Fr. 164.
dash the white spray off the oar, E. IT 1387.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., become quite white, Thphr. CP 5.9.9, Thd. Da. 12.10.
quite white, Hp. Prog. 2, Arist. HA 617a12, PCair.Zen. 129.18, LXX Le. 13.24: Comp., inclining to white, Arist. HA 592b7.
cease utterly, δακρυρροοῦσα S. El. 1312: abs., Herod. 3.87.
ἐκλανθάνομαι, τῶν συγκειμένων App. Mac. 11.5.
one must select, Arist. APr. 43b16.
one must take in a certain sense, Sch. Ar. Nu. 298, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: one must evacuate, κύστιν Orib. Syn. 9.55.1.
contractor of works, PFay. 58.6 (ii A.D.), etc.
tax-collector, Just. Nov. 130.3, al.
play antics, behave absurdly, Plb. 15.26.8.
forgetting and forgiving, Od. 24.485.
undertake and complete a public burden, Is. 7.40.
taking out, collecting, Dsc. 1.68.4; removing, Id. 3.90.
farming of taxes, BGU 897.1, Just. Nov. 123.6; of any trade enterprise, PTeb. 38.11 (ii B.C.).
isolation, dissecting out, of an aneurism, Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.24.3; of a varicose vein, ib. 4.36.7.
taking of extract from a document, Mitteis Chr. 185 (ii A.D.), Cod.Just. 10.11.8.4a, etc.
clear of stones, τὰς πέτρας IG ΙΙ(2).199 A 85 ( Delos, iii B.C., ἐγλ-).
clear by picking off the stones, Thphr. CP 3.20.5.
turn into stone, Tz. H. 1.556.
winnow, sift, empty, LXX Ju. 2.27, Wi. 5.23.
exceeding hunger, faintness, LXX De. 28.20, Aq. Jb. 41.14.
flood completely, τὸ πεδίον ἐ. ὁ ποταμός App. BC 4.107: pf. Pass. ἐκλελιμνάσθαι Sch. Th. Oxy. 853x12:—also ἐκ-λιμνιάζω, abs., of a river, overflow its banks, App. Fr. 1.3.
become a complete swamp, D.H. 1.61.
emaciated, Thphr. CP 2.4.6.
faint with hunger, Aq. De. 28.65.
abandon, E. Med. 800, PHamb. 27.14 (iii B.C.), Ant.Lib. 16.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: cease, οὔποτʼ ἐξελίμπανον θρυλοῦσα E. El. 909.
to be lacking, Them. in APo. 38.29.
to be eclipsed, Ascl. in Metaph. 11.31.
escape out of the net, Eust. 574.30.
make smooth as oil, πέλαγος Posidipp. ap. Ath. 7.318d:— Pass., to be enriched, fertilized, Plu. Mar. 21.

entreat earnestly, move by entreaty, Str. 17.1.29: c. inf., Plu. Them. 5, Jul. Or. 7.220b: abs., Ph. 2.521, J. AJ 5.7.8, Apollon. Mir. 3; πολλὰ ἐ. D.L. 4.7:— Pass., D.H. 7.10, Str. 14.5.10, Memn. 7.2.
failing, deficient, ἡλίου ἐκλιπές τι ἐγένετο, = ἔκλειψις, Th. 4.52: c. gen., deficient in.., Arist. Xen. 980a6.

children.label: II
children.definition: omitted, overlooked, Th. 1.97, Arr. An. 1.12.2.
slap, Eust. 1119.59.
absorb, exhaust, Ph. 1.124, Ael. Fr. 82.
collector of firstfruits, taxes, etc., καρπῶν IG 1(2).76.14; φόρου Lys. Fr. 9, IG 12(5).1001.14 ( Ios, iv B.C., ἐγλ-), Ph. 2.33, al.
collect, τὰ διάφορα IG 5(1).1390.47 ( Andania).
select, CPHerm. p.80 (iii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., excuse oneself, ὑπέρ τινος App. BC 5.77; ἐ. τὴν ἀνάγκην plead in excuse, ib. 13: c. acc. et inf., to state by way of excuse that.., ib. 3.48; μικρὰ ὑπὲρ ἐμαυτοῦ Them. Or. 8.103d.

choice, selection, τῶν ἀρχόντων Pl. R. 414a, 536c; ἐ. ποιεῖσθαι Id. Lg. 802b; ἐ. [ τῶν ἀρίστων νόμων] Arist. EN 1181a18; τῶν ἐναντίων Id. Metaph. 1004a2; ὀνομάτων Phld. Rh. 1.162 S., D.H. Comp. 1, etc.; ὀνόματος A.D. Synt. 71.10; κατʼ ἐκλογὴν ἀριστίνδην κεκριμένοι Plb. 6.10.9; ἐπὶ ἐγλογῇ γεωργεῖν PTeb. 5.166 (ii B.C.).
levying of troops, Plb. 5.63.11.
collection of tribute, etc., κριθῶν Lex Attica ap. Ath. 6.235c; χρημάτων D.C. 42.6; σίτου Crates ap. Ath. 6.235b.
election, Ep.Rom. 9.11, etc.; σκεῦος ἐκλογῆς Act.Ap. 9.15.
balancing of accounts, PRyl. 157.6 (ii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: extract, quotation from a book, Apollon. Cit. 3, Ath. 14.663c, Antig. Mir. 15.
choice collection of passages, such as the Eclogae or ‘Elegant Extracts’ of Stobaeus: ἐκλογαὶ Ἀρχιγένους select prescriptions of A., Gal. 14.343.
διὰ τὴν ἐ. τῶν ἀνθρώπων because they were picked men, Plb. 1.47.9, cf. Ph. 2.362.
ἐκλογήν· κάλαθον ( Lacon.), Hsch.
schedule of payments, PStrassb. 103.2 (iii B.C.).
compute, reckon, τὰς εὐθύνας Harp. s.v. λογισταί; τὸ ἀργύριον IG 9(1).694.104 (Corc.), cf. 22.1263.12:— Pass., ἀριθμὸν..ἐκ τῶν ἀντιγράφων -λογισθέντα ib. 7.3073.56 ( Lebad.).

consider, reflect on, τι Hdt. 3.1, E. IA 1409, Th. 4.10; περί τινος Id. 2.40, And. 1.57; ἐ. πρὸς οἵους..ὁ ἀγὼν ἔσται Th. 1.70; ἐ. ὅτι.. D. 21.123; τίς ὢν πρὸς οὕστινας ἐπολέμει Aeschin. 1.64: aor. ἐκλογισθῆναι in pass. sense, to be calculated, Plu. Publ. 15.
reckon on, οὐδεὶς ἔθʼ αὑτοῦ θάνατον ἐκλογίζεται E. Supp. 482.
reckon up, relate in detail, Plb. 3.99.3, 10.9.3, D.H. 11.40.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐκλογέομαι, τινὶ περί τινος App. BC 3.43.
computation, reckoning, Epicur. Sent. 18.

keeping of accounts, in pl., Inscr.Prien. 108.214 (ii B.C.), Phalar. Ep. 24; computation, calculation, Haussoullier Cinquantenaire de lʼécole des hautes études p. 88 ( Didyma, ii B.C.), Plu. Cat.Mi. 36; consideration, reckoning, in pl., Plb. 1.59.2, D.H. Th. 3, Plu. Oth. 9 (v.l.), etc.; setting out of grammatical paradigms, D.T. 629.8; conclusion of an argument, Hp. Nat.Puer. 12.
to be ἐκλογιστής, CIG 3886 ( Eumeneia), PEdgar 44 (iii B.C.).
office of ἐκλογιστής, PLond. 1.23.110.
accountant, LXX To. 1.22; as public official, Milet. 7.60 ( Didyma), PTeb. 72.449 (ii B.C.), AJA 18.324 ( Sardes, i B.C.), CIG 4956.36 (Oasis Thebarum, i A.D.), etc.
reckoning: accounts, LXX To. 1.21, Sammelb. 4423.
capable of estimating, τῶν οἴκῳ συμφερόντων Muson. Fr. 3p.10H.: abs., Phld. Herc. 1003.
tale, A. Fr. 219.

children.label: II
children.definition: balance of accounts, PLond. 1.131.6 (i A.D.), etc.
picked out, choice, Ph. 2.479, 539; ᾠδή Max.Tyr. 17.1 [11.1.b].
ἔκλογον ὄν· μεταξὺ λόγων, Hsch.
adjourn, in Pass., Gloss.
bathing-costume, PCair.Zen. 60.8 (iii B.C.).
for washing out or rinsing, χαλκίον ἐ. IG 4.39.18 ( Aegina).
washing-vessel, Poll. 10.46.
wash out, Hp. Steril. 241.

children.label: II
children.definition: wash thoroughly, Plb. 3.88.1:— Pass., λουτροῖς ἐκλελουμένος δέμας A. Fr. 32; ἐγλοηθείς PPetr. 2pp. 72,73 (iii B.C.).
quarry from a hill, Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. ἐξελοφίζετο.
an offspring, Suid. s.v. Πολύευκτος.
bring forth, Orph. A. 129, AP 9.602 ( Even.):—so in Med., E. Hel. [258]: metaph., λόγον Orph. A. 43:— Pass., to be born, E. Ion 1458 (anap.).
pick out of a cohort or troop, LXX Ca. 5.10 ( Pass.).
become bushy, Thphr. CP 3.19.1.
twist exceedingly, ἐκλελυγισμέναι ὀρχήσεις mazy dances, Porph. Abst. 1.33.

definition: ἔκλυρον χλωρόν, δίυγρον, ἢ νοτερόν, ἔνικμον, ὑγρόν, Hsch.

children.definition: release, deliverance from a thing, ἀφροσύνης Thgn. 590 (= Sol. 13.70); ἄθλων A. Pr. 264; τοῦδε τοῦ νοσήματος S. OT 306; δεσμοῦ Theoc. 24.33; Ἀΐδεω AP 6.219.24 (Antip.(?)).
weakening of an opponentʼs case, Hdn. Fig. p.91 S., cf. Alex. Fig. 1.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: feebleness, faintness, Hp. Aph. 7.8, etc.; τῆς πόλεως ἔ. καὶ μαλακία D. 17.29; ψυχικῶν δυνάμεων Ph. 1.154; φυσική Agatharch. 55; ἐκλύσιες κοιλίης relaxations, Hp. Coac. 625.
laxity, of style, [ Longin.] Rh. 12.

children.label: III
children.definition: lowering of the voice through three quarter-tones ( διέσεις), Bacch. Intr. 41, Aristid.Quint. 1.10, Plu. Mus. 2.1141b.

definition: ἐκλυσσάω, Att. ἐκλυττάω, strengthd. for λυσσάω, Ph. 1.430, J. AJ 13.16.3.

children.definition: bringing release, S. OT 392: -τήριον, τό, expiatory offering, E. Ph. 969.
calculated to weaken, Arist. GA 726b13; ὥρα Aët. 16.22: metaph., τῶν λόγων Herm. in Phdr. p.103 A.
easy to let go, light, buoyant, of missiles, E. Andr. 1133.

children.label: II
children.definition: let loose, unbridled, ἵμεροι Ti.Locr. 102e; lascivious, φιλήματα Lyd. Mag. 3.65; unlimited, extreme, βουλιμία Timocl. 13.3; ἔ. καὶ βαρύ Olymp. in Mete. 198.12.

children.label: III
children.definition: relaxed, unnerved, E. Tr. 1179, dub. in Eup. 147; exhausted, Nic.Dam. p.98 D.; deprived of force, of an engine, Ph. Bel. 85.10; weak, κίνησις Olymp. in Mete. 169.2; τόνος τοῦ φθέγματος Luc. Im. 13; diluted, watery, οἶνος Gp. 7.1.4, cf. Gal. 12.278; loose, of proof, Eudem. ap. Theo Sm. p.200 H.; mild (opp. σφοδρόν), γυμνάσιον Gal. 6.156. Adv. -τως by being relaxed, Plu. Lyc. 17; weakly, Agathin. ap. Gal. 8.938.

children.label: IV
children.definition: curing by λύσις (opp. κρίσις), ἡμέραι Gal. 9.817.
redeem by payment of ransom, SIG 588.70 ( Milet., ii B. C.), Sch. Od. 4.33.— Act. only in Hsch.
redemption, LXX Nu. 3.49.

set free, πόνων from labours, A. Pr. 328; release, ὕδατα PTeb. 49.6 (ii B. C.):— Pass., to be set free, ἐκλέλυμαι πόθου Thgn. 1339; ἐκ δεσμῶν Pl. Phd. 67d:— Med., get one set free, release, ἀλλʼ ἄγε δή σε κακῶν ἐκλύσομαι Od. 10.286; τοῦ φόβου σʼ ἐξελυσάμην S. OT 1003; θανάτου νιν ἐκλύσασθε E. Andr. 818; ἐξελυσάμην βροτοὺς τὸ μὴ μολεῖν A. Pr. 237: c. acc. pers. only, ἐξελύσαντο τοὺς Ἀργείους X. HG 7.1.25: abs., ἐξελυσάμην I delivered him from danger, S. Aj. 531.

data.quote: ἀλλʼ ἄγε δή σε κακῶν ἐκλύσομαι

children.label: II
children.definition: unloose, ἐ. τόξα unstring a bow, Hdt. 2.173; ἐ. ἁρμούς E. Hipp. 825; σκαιὸν ἐκλύσων στόμα likely to let loose a foolish tongue, S. Aj. 1225.

make an end of, ἐξέλυσας..σκληρᾶς ἀοιδοῦ δασμόν paid it off, Id. OT 35; ἐπίπονον ἁμέραν Id. Tr. 654; μόχθον E. Ph. 695; ἔριν καὶ φιλονικίαν D. 9.14; ἐξελύσατε (v.l. -λύσασθε) τὰς παρασκευάς Id. 18.26.

relax, Arist. HA 610a27; τῆς φροντίδος τὸ ἀκριβές Luc. Dom. 17:— Pass., to be faint, fail, Hp. Aph. 2.41, Isoc. 15.59, D. 19.224, Phld. Ir. p.69 W., etc.; πρὸς τὸν πόλεμον Isoc. 4.150; ἐκλυθῆναι τοῖς σώμασι, τῇ ψυχῇ, Arist. Fr. 144, Plb. 29.17.4 (so intr. in Act., J. BJ 1.33.5), etc.; of things, to be unserviceable, τὰ τῶν πλοίων ἐκλελυμένα Arist. Pol. 1320b37; ἐκλύεται ὁ ῥοῦς, τὰ ῥεύματα, cease, Plb. 4.43.9, 4.41.5.
ἐ. κοιλίαν relax the bowels, Dsc. 4.169.
pay in full, δάνειον Plu. Caes. 12 ( Pass.).

children.label: b
children.definition: purchase, Herod. 6.91.
resolve a doubt, in Pass., A.D. Synt. 176.24; also τὰ ὑπʼ ἀμφιβολίαν πίπτοντα ἐκλύεται τοῦ ἀμφιβόλου ib. 311.11.
dissolve, τι ὄξει Gal. 11.106.

children.label: III
children.definition: to break up, depart, LXX 2 Ma. 13.16.
sustain grievous injuries, ἅγωγʼ ὑπʼ αὐτῶν ἐξελωβήθην S. Ph. 330.
lay bare, ἐκ δʼ ἐλώπισε πλευράν S. Tr. 925.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch.
Achae. 31:— Act. in aor. I, Hsch. (prob.).
napkin, Pl. Ti. 72c, Meyer Ostr. 62.5 (ii B.C.).
that which wipes off, gets rid of, αἵματος μέλανος, of the spleen, Aret. SD 1.15; rough towel, Archig. ap. Gal. 12.621, Paul.Aeg. 1.57.

children.label: II
children.definition: that on or in which an impression is made, κήρινον ἐ. lump of wax, Pl. Tht. 191c, cf. 196a; of matter ( φύσις) as a recipient of impressions, Id. Ti. 50c, Arist. Metaph. 988a1; [ σῶμα] ἐ. αὐτῆς τῆς γενέσεως Ocell. 2.3.
impress, mould, Pl. Tht. 194d, 194e, Ph. 1.279: metaph., ἐκμαγεῖον πέτρης impress of the rocks, of a fisherman who is always wandering over them, AP 6.193 ( Flacc.).
model, Pl. Lg. 800b, 801d; μηχανῆς Procop. Aed. 2.3.
bewitch, Iamb.Bab. 9.
impression in wax, etc., Poll. 9.131.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hp. Steril. 235.
thorough knowledge, Phld. Po. 5.2.
bring to the birth, Simp. in Ph. 786.21.

drive mad with passion, ἐκμήνας θυμὸν ἔρωτι Pl. Epigr. 6.6 Diehl, cf. Theoc. 5.91; ἐπί τινι with love for her, Ar. Ec. 966; φόβῳ τέτρωρον ἐκμαίνων ὄχον E. Hipp. 1229; πόθον ἐκμῆναι to kindle mad desire, S. Tr. 1142; ἐκμῆναί τινα δωμάτων to drive one raving from the house, E. Ba. 36:— Pass., with pf. 2 Act. ἐκμέμηνα, go mad with passion, ταῦτα ἐκμαίνεσθαι ἔς τινα rage so against one, Hdt. 3.33, cf. 37, Paus. 1.11.15; ἔρωτι οὐρανίῳ ἐκμεμηνυῖα [διάνοια] Ph. 1.482; of mania, Aret. SD 1.6; ὑπὸ τοῦ ἀκράτου Luc. Nigr. 5; of sexual passion, εἰς γυναῖκας ἐκμανείς J. AJ 8.7.5: also, c. acc., ἐκμανῆναί τινα to be madly in love with.., Anacreont. 11.4; τινί Aristaenet. 1.15 tit.; of persons in delirium, Hp. Epid. 3.17.ιγʹ.
express, εἴδη Emp. 22.7.
impress, ποδῶν E. El. 535.
relax, weaken, τὰ σώματα Plu. Fr. 20.1; soften, mollify, τραχύτητας γλώσσης Dsc. Eup. 2.17: metaph., ὀργήν τινος J. AJ 2.6.8.
softening, enervating, Erot. s.v. ἐκθήλυνσις.
quite mad, πρὸς τὰ ἀφροδίσια Nicias ap. Ath. 10.437e; λύτται Ph. 1.408. Adv. -νῶς Ath. 13.603a.

learn thoroughly, and, in past tenses, to have learnt thoroughly, know full well, ἐ. τὴν [Ἑλλάδα] γλῶσσαν Hdt. 2.154; ἀνδρὸς ψυχήν S. Ant. 175; ἐ. τι ἀπό τινος A. Pr. 256; ἔκ τινος Pl. Ax. 371a; παρά τινος S. OT 286; τοῦ θεοῦ τί πρακτέον ib. 1439, cf. OC 114, Ar. Ec. 244; ἐ. ὅτι.. Hdt. 3.134.

children.label: II
children.definition: examine closely, search out, Id. 7.28, E. IT 667, X. Cyr. 1.6.40.

children.label: III
children.definition: learn by heart, ὅλους ποιητάς Pl. Lg. 811a, cf. Aeschin. 3.135; ᾄσματα Thphr. Char. 27.7; Σαπφοῦς τἀρωτικά Epicr. 4; Διονυσίου δράματα Ephipp. 16; ἵνα πολλάκις ἀκούοντες τῶν ἐπῶν ἐκμανθάνωμεν τὴν ἔχθραν Isoc. 4.159.

data.quote: ἵνα πολλάκις ἀκούοντες τῶν ἐπῶν ἐκμανθάνωμεν τὴν ἔχθραν

children.definition: wiping, Arist. Insomn. 460a16.
make to fade or wither away, Thphr. Ign. 11, AP l.c.:— Pass., wither away, Theoc. 3.30.
go raving mad, ἐξεμαργώθης φρένας E. Tr. 992.
to bear witness to a thing, c. acc., φόνον A. Eu. 461; ἐκμαρτύρησον..τό μʼ εἰδέναι Id. Ag. 1196; εἰς πολλούς before many persons, Aeschin. 1.107:— Pass., Str. 12.8.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: make depositions out of court, Is. 3.21, Test. ap. D. 35.20, Aeschin. 2.19.
deposition of absent witness, POxy. 1208.30 (iii A.D.).
the deposition of a witness taken out of court, -ίας ποιεῖσθαι Is. 3.21 (pl.), D. 46.7, Aeschin. 2.19, SIG 953.41 ( Calymna, ii B.C., pl.).
evidence, Anon. ap. Suid.; ἐν ἐκμαρτυριοις Just. Nov. 90.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: official certificate, PMasp. 87.21 (vi A.D.), BGU 1094.16 (vi A.D.).
prove by evidence, τι Just. Nov. 22.14.
give testimony, ib. 91.2.
chew completely, in aor. Pass. -μασήθην Ph. 1.334.
devised or invented, τέχνην h.Merc. 511; cf. μαίομαι.

definition: ἐκμάσσω, Att. ἐκμάττω, pf. ἐκμέμᾰχα ( ἐκμέμα-κα codd.) cj. in D.H. Dem. 4: aor. 2 Pass. -εμάγην [ᾰ] Pl. Tht. 191d; also aor. 1 part. ἐκμαχθείς Hsch.:—

children.definition: wipe off, wipe away, κάρᾳ κηλῖδας ἐξέμαξεν S. El. 446; ἔκμασσε [ τὸ αἷμα] E. HF 1400; ἀλωπεκίας ὀθονίῳ Archig. ap. Gal. 12.406:— Med., wipe away oneʼs tears, AP 5.42 ( Rufin.).
wipe dry, ὑπὸ σπόγγου Hp. Acut. 65 ( Pass.), cf. Herod. 6.9; [ τοὺς ἔμπροσθεν πόδας] ἐ. εἰς τοὺς μέσους, of bees, Arist. HA 624b1.

children.label: II
children.definition: mould or model in wax or plaster, αὑτὸν ἐκμάττειν τε καὶ ἐνιστάναι εἰς τοὺς τῶν κακιόνων τύπους to mould and adapt oneself to.., Pl. R. 396d; of pessaries, Hp. Steril. 230:—so in Med., Id. Nat.Mul. 109; ὧν ἔτι θερμὰ κονία.. ἐκμάσσεται ἴχνη of whose yet warm footsteps the dust receives the impress, Theoc. 17.122; express, imitate, ἵππου γενεήν Nic. Th. 740; τὸν Λυσιακὸν χαρακτῆρα ἐκμέμακται D.H. Dem. 13 (so in Act., ib. 4 codd., dub.); ἐς τὸ ἀκριβέστατον ἐξεμάξατο τὸν διδάσκαλον he was the image of his master, Alciphr. 3.64:— Pass., μάλθης ἄναγνα σώματʼ ἐκμεμαγμένοι (v.l. -μένα) S. Ichn. 140; ἐκεῖνος αὐτὸς ἐκμεμαγμένος his very image, Cratin. 255; βασιλέως..εἰκόνʼ ἐκμεμ. IGRom. 1.1190 ( Memnon); ὃ ἂν ἐκμαγῇ whatever be impressed, whatever impression be made (cf. ἐκμαγεῖον), Pl. Tht. 191d; τὴν ἰδέαν τοῦ παιδὸς ἐκμεμάχθαι had impressed upon him the image of the boy, Plu. Cic. 44; ποιότης ἀπὸ μένοντος ἐκμαγεῖσα θείου λόγου Ph. 1.548.

data.quote: ποιότης ἀπὸ μένοντος ἐκμαγεῖσα θείου λόγου

children.definition: track out, ὡς κύων νεβρὸν πρὸς αἷμα ἐ. A. Eu. 247, Ph. Bybl. ap. Eus. PE 1.9.

data.quote: ὡς κύων νεβρὸν πρὸς αἷμα ἐ.

children.definition: scourge, in Med., Hsch. s.v. ἐκδέψηται.
make quite drunk: metaph., τὰς ῥίζας..λίαν ἐ. over-charge them with moisture, Thphr. CP 5.15.3; λύχνον ἐλαιηρῆς ἐ. δρόσου AP 5.3 ( Phld.).
appeasing, taming, κυνῶν Eust. 1749.43.
soften, Gal. 11.317.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., appease, Corn. ND 21, App. BC 1.97, Plu. Isid. 2.380c, D.C. 79.19, Conon 18.
obtain for oneʼs lot, aor. 2 ἐξέμμορον Nic. Th. 791; θεῶν ἐξέμμορε τιμῆς Od. 5.335.
to be darkened, grow dark, Heraclit. All. 39; ὑπὸ [ νυκτός] ib. 45.
lose colour, Olymp.Alch. p.91 B.
false note, D.H. Comp. 11: metaph., Corn. ND 32.

children.label: II
children.definition: carelessness, Zos. 1.23, al.
train or teach carefully, τινά Pl. Hp.Ma. 287a.
learn perfectly, con over, practise, Antipho 3.2.7, Pl. Hp.Ma. 286d; τὴν εἰς τὸ θεῖον ἐ. βλασφημίαν Men. 715.

data.quote: τὴν εἰς τὸ θεῖον ἐ. βλασφημίαν

children.definition: out of tune, dissonant, Ph. 1.375, al., Ti.Locr. 101b, Plu. Demetr. 1; unbridled, φιλοτιμία Id. Lys. 23; of persons, Just. Nov. 136.6. Adv. -λῶς Poll. 4.57.
dismember, LXX 4 Ma. 10.5, 8.

definition: ἔκμελος ἀδύναμος, Hsch. ἐκμεταιωροῦνται· μετεωρίζονται, Id.

children.definition: empty of ore or metal, Str. 14.5.28 ( Pass.).
from a mine, ἅλς Sch. Nic. Al. 518 (s.v.l.).

measure out, measure, χρόνον E. IA 816; κύκλος τις ὡς τόρνοισιν ἐκμετρούμενος Id. Fr. 382; ἐ. τὸν βίον to end life, to die, Tz. H. 3.800: abs., measure a distance, ἐπὶ τὰς πόλεις LXX De. 21.2:—freq. in Med., measure for oneself, measure out, ἄστροις..ἐκμετρούμενος χθόνα measuring, calculating its position by the stars (for he was an exile), S. OT 795; take measure of, τὰ ἐκείνου ὅπλα X. Cyr. 6.4.2, cf. Plb. 5.98.2 :— Pass., PTeb. 61 (b). 258 (ii B.C.), etc.
measurement, Plb. 5.98.10, BGU 432 ii 10 (ii A.D.), ἐκμετρ-ητής, οῦ, ὁ, measurer, surveyor, PAmh. 2.79.16 (ii A.D.), etc.
out of measure, measureless, ὄλβος S. Fr. 353, cf. Man. 4.464, 626; of a verse, exceeding the due length, Luc. Pr.Im. 18.

definition: ἐκμηκύνω, strengthd. for μηκύνω, D.H. 1.56 ( Pass.), 6.83, J. BJ 7.8.3 ( Pass.).

children.definition: of six months, half-yearly, ἑκμήνους χρόνους (Pors. for ἐμμήνους) S. OT 1137 ; βίος Arist. HA 558a17 : Subst. ἕκμηνος, ὁ, half-year, ἐντὸς ἑκμήνου Pl. Lg. 916b ; ἐν ἑγμήνῳ IG 12(9).207.52 ( Eretria, iii B.C.), cf. D.C. 59.6 ; ἕ. (sc. ἀρχή), ἡ, Plb. 6.34.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: six months old, of an animal, Arist. HA 562b27; μὴ πρεσβύτερον ἐνιαυσίου καὶ ἑγμήνου IG 12(5).647.8 ( Ceos).
inform of, betray, Plu. Pel. 9 ( Pass.), Poll. 5.154.
wind off like a ball of thread, Jul. Gal. 135c ; of an army, make it defile out, τὴν δύναμιν ἐκ τῶν δυσχωριῶν Plb. Fr. 132 ; διὰ στενῆς θυρίδος.. ἐκμηρυόμενος αὑτόν Plu. Aem. 26.

children.label: II
children.definition: defile, X. An. 6.5.22 ; τῆς χαράδρας Plb. 3.53.5 (but τὰς δυσχωρίας ib. 51.2).

children.label: III
children.definition: evolve itself, develop, Dam. Pr. 65, cf. eund. ap. Simp. in Ph. 780.30.
contrive, J. AJ 8.3.4, Hsch.
pollute thoroughly, defile, Opp. H. 4.663 :— Pass., ejaculate semen, Hp. Superf. 31, Ar. Ra. 753, LXX Le. 18.20.
imitate faithfully, represent exactly, E. HF 1298, Ar. Av. 1285, X. Mem. 3.10.1, Duris 89 J.
imitation, Arg.2 Ar. Av.
hate much, Plu. Phil. 12 ( Pass.).
receiving no pay, Hsch.
let out for hire, ὁλκάδας X. Vect. 3.14; χωρίον Lys. 7.4; [τέμενος] SIG 1044.30 (Halic.), etc. : c. inf., ἐ. τινὰ ἑταιρεῖν Aeschin. 1.13 :— Med., contract for, ἔργον Them. Or. 4.53a.

definition: ἐκμολεῖν, inf. of aor. 2 ἐξέμολον, Ep. 3 sg. ἔκμολε,

children.definition: go out, go forth, Il. 11.604 ; ἐξέμολεν A.R. 1.845 ; cf. βλώσκω.
pollute, in Pass., Ar. Ra. 753 cod.V.
represent, express in form, Plu. Inv. 2.537d :— Pass., τὰς ἐκμεμορφωμένας διὰ τῶν αἰσθήσεων τέρψεις Phld. D. 3.14.

data.quote: τὰς ἐκμεμορφωμένας διὰ τῶν αἰσθήσεων τέρψεις

children.label: II
children.definition: bring into shape, Ael. NA 2.19.
teach fully, τινά τι E. Ba. 825 :— Pass., ἐκμουσωθῆναί τι Ael. VH 14.34.
work out with toil, κερκίσιν πέπλους E. El. 307.
struggle through, πόνους Id. IT 1455, cf. A. Pr. 825, Porph. ap. Eus. PE 3.11.
win by labour, achieve, Ἑλένην ἐ. δορί E. Tr. 873 ; ἐκμοχθῶν βίᾳ εὔκλειαν Id. HF 1369.
struggle out of, τὰς τῶν θεῶν τύχας ib. 309.
Pass., to be worn out, ὅσοι δεσμοῖς ἐκμεμόχθηνται βροτῶν Id. Fr. 332.5 (s. v.l.).
dislodgement, φλέγματος Aët. 16.21.

definition: ἐκμόχλευσις, εως, ἡ, f.l. for ἐκχόλωσις, Paul.Aeg. 3.13.

children.definition: lift out with a lever, Hp. Art. 72 (and in Med., ib. 76); πύλας ἐ. to force them open with crow-bars, Ar. Lys. 429 : generally, force, compel, τὴν φύσιν Plu. QConv. 2.662c; dislodge, τὰ λυποῦντα Gal. 7.195, cf. Archig. ap. Orib. 8.1.22 ; τὴν κακοχυμίαν τῶν σωμάτων Olymp. in Grg. p.143J.
suck the marrow out of, deprive of strength, LXX Nu. 24.8.

suck out, αἷμʼ ἐκμυζήσας Il. 4.218, cf. Luc. Tim. 8, Ael. NA 3.39, Gal. UP 6.15, Q.S. 4.398 ; exhaust air from a vessel, Hero Spir. I Praef.: metaph., extort, Lyd. Mag. 3.67 :—also in form ἐκμύζω, Dsc. Eup. 1.62, Phlp. in Mete. 115.18 :— Pass., Antyll. ap. Orib. 7.16.16:—also ἐκμυζέω, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.59 : metaph., drain, exhaust, [στάσις] ἐ. τὰς δυνάμεις Aristid. Or. 23(42).31.
sucking out, Sor. 1.77, Philum. Ven. 7.3, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.59.
